loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks to expand her business, thus aiding her to control her overall expenses.

loans.name: Jenga Group

texts.en:
Silvano is in his mid 20s and is single.  He has been selling fruit for five years.  He works from 6am to noon daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Silvano's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to use the loan amount to buy popular fruit like mango and pineapple.  He dreams of building his own house.

Silvano will share this loan with his 7-member loan group "Jenga".  They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy popular fruit like mango and  pineapple to resell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.fr: Nadia jeune femme de 25ans est revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et son premier crédit octroyé à WAGES lui servira d'acheter des marchandises pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients en cette période de fête de fin d'année. Elle a démarré en 2009 et espère devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en:
Nadia, age 25, is an itinerant seller of pagnes. She buys her stock in Lomé, and she will use her first loan from WAGES to buy enough merchandise to meet customer demand over the new-year holiday season. 

She started her activity in 2009, and she hopes to become a wholesaler and start a family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, wigs, handbags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions such as rice, milo, oil, groceries, etc. to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and his four children, two of whom attend the public school. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life.

Shareef is asking Ryada for this loan. He will use it to paint his house and extend the plumbing. The loan will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money with which to buy the things he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and extend the plumbing

loans.name: Azucar Y Canela Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento AZUCAR Y CANELA está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varónes, que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es  la señora Guadalupe tiene 41 años tiene 2 hijos,   ella se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de chocolates con distintos  diseños,  ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando distintas oficinas y ferias y mercados ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Guadalupe va a usar este préstamo para la compra de moldes para los diseños de los chocolates,  la señora Guadalupe va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos ya que esta época es donde tiene buena venta y de esta manera genera buenos ingresos,   se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Azucar y Canela communal bank comprise eight members, six women and two men, who do a variety of work. Guadalupe, 41, is the group's president  and has two children. She makes and sells chocolates of different types as a street vendor, going to offices, fairs, and markets to sell her merchandise. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. She will use the loan to buy molds to make chocolate designs. Guadalupe will use her profits to buy more supplies, since this is a great selling season, and she will be able to earn more money. She is pleased with and thankful for the opportunity the funding represents.

loans.use: to buy molds to make chocolates.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 47 years old and has three children. She operates a retail store where she sells cooking pans and stoves, which she has been doing for five years.  Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent premise for her business. 

Benter is requesting a loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cooking pans and stoves. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to rent a premise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pans and stoves

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children aged 7 years and 11 years. He operates a carpentry business, making tables, chairs and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate finances.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber for making furniture. His business goal is to be a major distributor within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will generate wealth for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated earnings to invest more in his business and to pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil and other items.

She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a growing area and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase her stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest more in her shop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La Señora Nancy sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de comida,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos al por mayor para la elaboración de sus vestidos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas para mejorar la comodidad en su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer y  seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Nancy continues in the same work, which is preparing and selling food. She says that her previous loan turned out very well for her, as she used it to buy ingredients at wholesale prices to make her meals. This time she is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to make her establishment more comfortable. She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity they give her to grow and continue to improve her business, and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Foad is 24 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife. He takes photos of weddings, birthdays, and any occasion that the customers want. This activity is his only income source. Foad asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy new video and photograph cameras to increase the number of clients and increase his income to improve the financial conditions for his family. Foad is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy new video and photograph cameras to increase the number of clients and increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase extra tools and equipment to start providing renovation and painting services at his workshop.

loans.name: Marcela Filerma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Marcela, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador y trabaja en la reparación de barcos.
Doña Marcela con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos pagar los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogos y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas. También parte del crédito se lo da al marido para que compre materiales que el utiliza en su trabajo, el realiza arreglos de soldadura en varios barcos que llegan al muelle y que necesitan de reparaciones para continuar con sus faenas de pesca. Con estas actividades es como ellos salen adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, productos Avon, soldaduras y pinturas para el trabajo de su marido. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben con los créditos. Su sueño es tener un buen bazar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Abdón Calderón in the city of Manta. This city is well-known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. It is also a city that is unequaled in its beauty and has many tourists attractions.

Sra. Marcela lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 7) who are in school. Her husband is a master welder and works at a boat repair shop.

In order to have her own income and to pay for her children's education, Doña Marcela sells clothing through catalogs and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells by going door to door. Marcela offers her products on credit and then collects payments weekly or every 15 days. She will also give part of her loan to her husband so that he can buy materials for his work. He does welding on different boats that come to the dock in need of repairs so that they can return to their fishing jobs. Through these activities, Marcela and her husband are able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, Avon products, as well as soldering supplies and paints for her husband's work. Marcela has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys being a member because of the assistance she has received with the loans. Her dream is to have a successful bazaar.

loans.use: to buy clothing, Avon products, as well as soldering supplies and paints for her husband's work.

loans.name: Luis Ecuador

texts.es:
LUIS  tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la convivienda en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo viejo se dedican a dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LUIS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos, una bomba para fumigar. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras y el clima.

El sueño es un negocio propio como una tienda de abarrotes y que atienda la conviviente. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis is thirty-nine years old. He lives in in a common-law marriage and has two children. He lives with his children and partner in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the "Anchoveta" communal bank. It's located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, Recinto Anchoveta, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo Canton where the people work in agriculture and ranching. 

Luis works in agriculture; he grows corn, rice, and beans. He is applying for this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, manure, and a sprayer for pesticide application. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and a pesticide sprayer to treat his fields.

He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas. The challenges that he faces are soil pests and diseases as well as the climate. 

His dream is to own a small business such as a grocery store and take care of his partner. In his spare time, he likes to go on walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, and a pesticide sprayer.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Alimamy.  He is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 2 years. One child attends school.

In 2011, Alimamy established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began his business because he dropped out of school (due to lack of sponsorship).  He joined his brother's business, who supplied him with patent medicines to be sold and paid back at a particular cost.  He was in the patent medicine business for some years and the commission he earned were used to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Alimamy requires a loan to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries.

Alimamy was not able to build a house or shop but he does improve his stock to meet demands.
This loan will help him to buy more stock and maximize profits.  He is an honest and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you and ARD for supporting his business.

loans.use: to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 13 years to 20 years. She operates a retail shop, where she sells drinks, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is that suppliers are located far from her business.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock, including drinks, washing soap and other items that she sells. Her business goal is to have a mini-supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock, including drinks, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba âgée de 45ans vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son mari, elle revend au marché des sacs et sachets plastiques. Son souhait est de développer son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille. A première demande faite à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter des sachets plastiques.
texts.en:
Ayaba, age 45, lives with her spouse and their children in Lomé. To help her husband, she sells plastic bags at the market. 

This first loan from WAGES will allow her to stock up on plastic bags. 

She wants to expand her activity and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 26-year-old, single man. He describes himself as honest and loyal. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is increasing fuel prices.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to increase his income within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best in the business. This is his first loan with SMEP-DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for insurance.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, parents and three children in the Marneuli district. His parents are provided with retirement pensions. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land and grow potatoes and tomatoes. In addition, they have a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Adil works hard to have a good harvest which is sold to local retailers. Adil decided to start a poultry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,000 to purchase hens. He will also purchase building materials to build a shed for hens. He will sell eggs and chicks locally and will generate more income. Adil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hens and build a shed

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang is 32 years old, and a mother of three children. She is a borrower from the Moung Russey district in the Battambang province. To feed the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming, and they have worked as paid workers for 15 years. She can earn around USD10 per day. She is a past client with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) and she successfully paid them back and has helped her family’s condition improve. Now she is a group leader of five; all of them are applying for a loan of 6,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that her rice will gain good crop yields to make her family’s income increase to build a better life.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en: Nazra is a 46-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw, which does not belong to him. With the help of savings he wants to buy new auto rickshaw, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy the new rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount.  Therefore, Nazra requested a loan for her son, so he can buy and happily drive a new rickshaw.  Nazra hopes that now her son will be able to generate a constant income. Nazra is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, fish, onion, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is aged 35 years. She is the mother of four children. Her husband has owned a vegetable shop in a nearby town, for many years. Her husband offers seasonal vegetables to his customers. He opens his shop early in the morning and closes at evening. But nowadays, he gets finished for the day too early, after selling all the vegetables. He wants to increase the stock available on a daily basis, so that he could sell the maximum amount of vegetables, until evening comes. This would enable him to get a maximum reward, for his efforts.

Therefore, Shenaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to buy more seasonal vegetables than he has in the past.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, for the growth of the business.

loans.name: Eisas' Group

texts.en:
Eisas is 31 years old, and she lives in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, all of whom are under her responsibility. To provide the family’s living, she and her husband have been in rice farming, and they work as paid laborers. They have been working like this for eleven years, and she can earn about 33,900 KHR per day.

Eisas has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans, which have helped her family to have enough food. Now, she is the leader of this group of two. She and her co-member are requesting loans of 1,300,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. Eisas is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor to help with the rice reaping and plowing. She hopes to expand her current business, for her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Dinora Guadalupe

texts.es: Dinora de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Dinora, 43, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She is known in her neighborhood for her humility and dedication to work. She never gives up and has always dealt with challenges. She puts great effort and determination into running her store, where she sells basic household items like grains, milk, eggs, and rice. She is dedicated to her job and offers good service; therefore, her customers seek her out and prefer her merchandise.

Dinora needs to stock more merchandise to meet growing demand, but she lacks the money to do so. So she has applied for a loan to buy merchandise like grains, instant food items, candy, beverages, etc. She trusts in God that the loan she is requesting will be provided soon and that she will have no worries besides providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy grains, instant food items, candy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 2 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado la calle principal de donde ella reside, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. La clienta quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, shorts y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives with her life partner and two children in her own house. She makes her living selling clothes. She has had this business for 2 years, and it has given her a lot of experience that allows her to earn a better income.

The business is located on the main street where she lives. She has acquired a lot of customers, because people know that everything is of quality and at reasonable prices.

The client wants to make a new investment, but does not have enough capital to back her up. That is why she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts and everything necessary for her business. She assures us that she will be able to repay the debt and also hopes that she will give her home financial security.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Camino A La Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Camino a la Esperanza está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar con exuberante vegetación, sus verdes campos  son producto de la agricultura, la arquitectura del sector es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Las socias se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y algunos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades,  pero siempre buscando el bienestar de sus familias ya que desean que sus hijos tengan mayores oportunidades de trabajo y se superen.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Dolores de Jesús, se encuentra desde hace 7 años en el grupo de crédito Camino a la Esperanza, grupo que le gusta ya que todas sus compañeras son amigas y solidarias, cada crédito le permite mejorar y crecer en su actividad económica. 
Ella tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 16 y 13 años  que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Dolores de Jesús se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene cerdos, gallinas y ganado del cual  obtiene la leche y con esta fábrica quesos, también se dedica a la agricultura  que es solo para el consumo de su hogar. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Camino a la Esperanza” [“Path to Hope”] is made up of seven women who live in and around the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, which is known for its lush vegetation, green fields of crops, and its mix of old and modern architecture. The members work in agriculture and raising animals, and some work in the city in various jobs. The members are always looking out for their families’ wellbeing, and they want their children to have better employment opportunities and to better themselves.

Dolores de Jesús has been a member of this group for seven years now. She likes the group because all of the members are friends and support each other, and because each loan allows her to improve and grow her business. Dolores de Jesús is 55 years old. She is a single mother with two children, ages 16 and 13, who study at a school in the city. The house in which they live is their own. Dolores de Jesús works raising animals, such as pigs, chickens and cows. She makes cheese from the milk from the cows. She also grows some crops, but only enough for use in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs and feed for her animals. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Ola is a 23-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of two young kids: a son and a daughter. For the past two years, Ola has been   raising bees. It is a good business and she earns a good income from selling honey. 

Ola took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to expand the farm and buy more beehives. By taking this loan, Ola will be able to increase her productivity and her income.

loans.use: to buy more beehives

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 32-year-old, married man from a small village near Tulkarm City. He is a father of four sons. For the past five years, Mahmoud has been working in a small store selling carpets. It is the only one in his area. Mahmoud would like to improve his store and buy more products because the demand increases in the winter.  Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to sell. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his sales and also his income.  Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, clothing accessories, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is Abdulai, 36. He is married and has 2 children ages 8 and 9. Both of them go to school. He has one additional dependent who is fostered and lives with him. 

In 2009, Abdulai established his provisions business. He began his business because he did not attend school; he was only introduced to farming.  When he become an adult, he farmed on his own and the proceeds he got were used to start selling retail. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 2,580,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Abdulai requires a loan to buy soft drinks, toothpaste, batteries, soap, etc. 

Abdulai has bought a piece of land; he hasn’t got the shop because of the high rentage cost, but he was able to buy a motorbike instead. His plan is to develop his piece of land and relocate his business in the Lorry Park.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, toothpaste, batteries, soap, etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 54-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and nine kids, five sons and four daughters. For the past few years, Omar has been working at selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. He buys his products from local farmers. It is a good business and earns a good income but still needs some money to improve it.

Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables from the local farmers to resell. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables from local farmers to resell

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 42-year-old, married man from a small village near Tulkarm city. He is a father of five sons. They all attend school. 

Saleem opened a small park for children in the village and he has a small pool in it. It is a good business, especially in the summer. 

Saleem took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to do some maintenance for the pool and improve it. By taking this loan, Saleem will prepare the park for the summer. Saleem appears in the photo in his park.

loans.use: to do some maintenance for the park pool and improve it.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khaled is 23 years old and he lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education. He didn’t surrender to the conditions but opened an office for copying and printing.
He worked in many fields and after three years decided to open his own office. He needs this youth loan to buy a computer to save his customers' information and better organize his work. It would also give him a good customer database for the future. He also wants to buy an additional photo copier which will increase the number of customers and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  
Khaled is grateful to everyone helping him to achieve success. He believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy a computer to save his customers' information, and photo copier to increase the number of his customers

loans.name: Mikheili

texts.en: Mikheili is a 26-year-old young man, who lives in Akhaltsikhe city. He lives with his parents. His mother works as a cleaner and gets 240 GEL monthly and his father is an electrician, whose generated salary consists of 500 GEL. Mikheili is unemployed nowadays, and has a great desire to start his own activity. He couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. He requested a loan of 2300 USD to purchase a mini-bus, transport cargoes and also rent it after getting private orders. This will give him a chance to earn income and become financially independent. In regards to the Start Up program, Mikheili will be able to make savings and provide a better future and tackle financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus.

loans.name: Raneen

texts.en:
Raneen is 21 years old and lives with her family in a small house. She currently has a home-based business weaving and selling handmade clothes from wool yarn, such as baby clothes and scarfs for women. She started this trade five years ago, learning her technique from workshop classes. In the beginning it was like a hobby. But she later decided to treat this as a business, besides her study. She sells her products in shops and directly to customers.

The youth loan she is currently taking out is to buy wool yarn and a wool machine, which will improve her speed and output. This allows her to generate income to support her family. Raneen is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn and a wool machine.

loans.name: Haja  I.

texts.en:
Haja is 29 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. In 2009, Haja began a provisions business, selling milk, ovaltine, mayonnaise, sugar, etc. She began her business because she came from a poor background and her parents did not have the capacity to see her through school. Her elder sister who was a trader was married in Freetown and Haja joined her sister in Freetown for her to assist her education, but her sister preferred to train her in the business.  

Haja works seven days a week, 16 hours a day and earns about 960,000 SLL every month from this business. She is requesting another loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase cartons of milk, ovaltine, drinks, toilet soap, etc. for her business. She has plans to complete her house and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, ovaltine, drinks, toilet soap etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, Vita, and others items  to expand her business,

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
In 2010, 11 women from a village stepped out and formed a group called "Maa Santoshi SHG" in Odisha. They help each other and share their problems and solve the problems among them.  They celebrate their festivals together in their village.  

Minarani, in the picture the girl standing with raised hand, is the leader of the group. She lives with her parents and siblings. She has six goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccines and fodder for them as they require. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they are grown. It takes 8-9 months for her to grow them for sale. She goes out in the morning let the goats graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family.  She resumes taking care of her goats, feeding them at home. Her brother assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way she is earning to control her cash flow, which however, is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.
	
She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. 

She has requested a loan of 110,000 INR for her group, so that they can earn more and control their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase ten more goat kids and fodder and vaccines for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dishes such as plates, pans, bowls, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Lapper (fabric) for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more artificial hair and slipper to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Andro Makha Leikai Shg Group

texts.en:
Little things that one often subconsciously takes for granted mean the world to a child who is parentless, says Kunjeshori, who is the profiled member for the group; she is also the featured borrower member. She is pictured with her hand raised. Prolonged ailments took away both her parents years ago and left her with no means of income.  She is unmarried but joined the women folk who formed this group to support one another in their businesses and called themselves Andro Makha Leikai SHG. The name of the group is similar to the place where the members live. It is about 35 kms from the capital town of Imphal and also one of the capital states for northeast India.

Brewing is Kunjeshori's main occupation to generate income. Brewing has been their customary practice for the community and luckily she learnt how to brew wine from relatives and neighbours. The brewed wines are generally used during festivals and community rituals as part of their customary practice. She also sells them to the village and nearby villagers for more income. She says she is not able to meet the demand because she does not have enough money to buy quality rice and yeast for brewing. She usually gets an advance payment from customers, brews the wine, and supplies it. The income generated is small and insufficient for business investment and savings. It has to be shared for daily expenses, her brother's job and other necessary expenses which leaves very little for purchasing rice and yeast for brewing wine.

With the help of the loan, she is hopeful that she will be able to brew a large quantity of wine. The brewing supplies like rice and yeast can be brought and kept in stock with the loan, in order to generate more income. She is glad that Kiva is supporting her and the group, acknowledges their hard work, and assists them financially. She says “Thank you so much, Kiva” and she will always remain grateful and obliged.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, brewing and piggery.

loans.use: To buy more rice for brewing wine to sell and generate more income for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water to sell at her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers for her business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hardworking old man. He has always had challenges, including limited capital and the high cost of education for his extended family.

He hopes that if he gets a loan, he will buy a few cows deep in the village. He will rear them for three months (since repayment is quarterly), and then sell the cows at a higher price. This will help him to get enough profits to pay tuition for his children, and to meet their other basic needs. He is grateful to Kiva lenders who lend through UGAFODE, for touching the lives of marginalized people. In the photograph are William and his wife, at their farm.

loans.use: To buy some cows

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is a 27-year-old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, she has been running business, stitching clothes. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Humaira requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

Humaira is in her fifth loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 55-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of four children. She enjoys her business weaving rugs and shawls. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has built a successful business. Noor has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and her daughters help in her work making beautiful rugs and shawls. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence. Currently, Noor is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as spools of wool and threads in different colors along with some cutters to increase her sales.  She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of wool, threads in different colors and some cutters.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 26-year-old widow and mother of one child. She is living at her mother’s home and running a small general store at home. She has two years of experience in this field. She has to face a lot of problems because she is handling all the business affairs alone.

She wants to buy inventory to sell from a general store, so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages. This will help to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Maurice Bruno

texts.fr: Maurice est un homme de 45 ans, veuf et père de 3 enfants tous allant à l'école. il possède et gère un pressing dans un quartier de la ville depuis 9 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières  en achetant des produits de lavage pour 300 000 francs afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital (ouverture d'une succursale) et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation)
texts.en:
Maurice, age 45, is the widowed father of three children who all go to school. 

He owns a laundry facility in a local district, which he has been operating for nine years. 

He is seeking this loan to stock up on supplies. He will buy 300,000f worth of laundry products to meet customer demand and to bolster his revenue. 

He plans to use his profits to reinvest in his business (open a second location) and to provide for his family’s needs (children’s education).

loans.use: to buy laundry products.

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney is 30 years old and happily married with a 3-year-old daughter. He completed high school in the year 2000, but was unable to attend college due to financial constraints.  

Before Sydney started running his own business, he worked for several years at an electrical company. He began running his own mobile money transfer business in October of 2012 so that he could earn some additional income to cover his household expenses. His business is located in a busy market called Kwacha, located in Kitwe town.

Sydney has requested a Kiva loan so that he can grow his business by increasing his working capital float. This is the money that Sydney uses to serve his customers who come to his shop to send/receive money and pay bills.

Sydney has high hopes for his future; he dreams of opening up more mobile money outlets so that he can have the finances to take himself back to school to persue an Electrical Technician Diploma.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business to service more customers in his community who need financial services

loans.name: Pepper Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Pepper Sellers” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective  businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Zainab. Zainab is aged 39, and was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a trader and the couple have four children – three are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Zainab has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – rice, pepper, onions, tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice, pepper, onions, tomatoes, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock. 

Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Gibrill, posing with the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, onions, tomatoes, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a mill.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es madre soltera. Tiene 32 años de edad. De escolaridad Primaria Completa. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 4 estan estudiaando. Se dedica a la elaboracion de guipiles típicos. Inició este negocio aprendiendo con su madre y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de Hilos para poder elaborar sus guipiles. Desea en el futuro ofrecer variedad de guipiles y poder vender por mayor. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesanía. 

Son 7 los integrantes del grupo, solo que uno de ellos no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Isabel is a single mother. She is 32 years old and completed primary school. She has 5 children, 4 of whom are studying. She makes her living making guipiles [traditional blouses]. She began this business learning from her mother, and to date, she has 4 years of experience.

She organizes a group and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy threads to make her guipiles. In the future, she hopes to offer a variety of guipiles and to be able to sell wholesale.

The rest of of the group members make their living in commerce and handicrafts. They are 7 members in the group, but one of them could not attend when the took the photo.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread.

loans.name: Alfonso Javier

texts.es: Don Alfonso tiene 44 años de edad, es padre de 5 hijos entre ellos unos gemelos de 19 años siendo los mayores, a todos los apoya por igual, con su pequeño ingreso vendiendo productos lácteos los cuales compra en el mercado y los vende en el barrio donde habita, su esposa le ayuda con su pequeña venta de cosméticos por catalogo, de esta manera esta familia sobreviven a los gastos diarios, don Alfonso con el crédito anterior logro realizar parte del porche de su casa, ahora con este segundo crédito que solicita realizara el muro perimetral de su vivienda, la cual es necesario par a la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Alfonso is 44 years old and the father of 5 children, including 19-year-old twins who are the oldest. He supports all of them equally with his small income from selling dairy products. He buys these products at the market and sells them in the neighborhood where he lives. His wife helps him with a small business selling cosmetics from a catalog. In this way, the family survives and covers its daily expenses. With the previous loan, Alfonso was able to finish the porch section of his house. Now, with this second loan he is requesting, he will complete the perimeter wall around his home, which is necessary for his children's safety.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars, concrete blocks and building stones.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 25-year-old single man; he describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be government policies which affect his business. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. 

His business goal is to be stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM, and he will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children aged 4 and 6 years old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of permanent business premises. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of shoes. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to increase stock.

loans.use: add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnut and beans for her business.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a safe and busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to feed his family.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia owns and operates a general store within her locality. She is 46 years old, and is happily married with three children. Two of her children are currently in college level, while her youngest child is in elementary grade. 

Olivia has been running her business for 18 years and usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Her income is just enough to cover their daily meals. Right now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, beverages and condiments to sell. She hopes to obtain her desired loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, beverages and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Esther operates a bakery where she cooks cakes and bread to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour, eggs and other ingredients for cooking cakes and bread. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cakes within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay utility bills.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, eggs and other ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a 69-year-old married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself to be determined and ever happy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, fruit and other crops to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Her business goal is to have dairy cows within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Women Unity Group

texts.en:
Inaocha belongs to the Women Unity Group and she is the featured profile member with her hand raised in the photo. Inaocha and her six friends from the same neighborhood joined hands together and formed the group. They live in a village that is about 35 km from the capital town of Manipur, which is also one of the northeastern states in India. Inaocha’s husband drives public transit vehicles and earns a monthly income. Inaocha weaves and her main source of income is weaving.

Inaocha used to use her small savings to pay for the security deposits as the yarn retailer would ask for security deposits. In order to get abundant supplies of woven products, Inaocha hires weavers and tailors and supplies them with the requisite materials like yarn and cloth materials. Inaocha pays them their weaving charge once they are ready. She collects the woven products and takes them to the market place to sell.  Her woven collection consists of bedcovers, pillow covers, mosquito net, blanket covers, wrap around skirts and women's shawls. 

With the KIVA loan, Inaocha is planning to hire more weavers and tailors who can’t get their own loom or sewing machines. She is also interested in getting a new loom for the hired weavers to use.  She will grant them their wages and supply them with the required materials, as she will be able to meet the demands the retailer have asked for. They are looking forward to KIVA for the support and believe that it will enhance their merchandise

She will continue her business and aspires to become one of the largest producers of woven clothes and tailored clothes in the respective area.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in embroidery work and weaving.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for weaving like yarn, threads and silk.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 42-year-old vigorous married woman and the mother of five children. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past four years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.

 Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Balqees’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 40,000, to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 46-year-old lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery. For about five years she is been doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her son. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 55,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would  consistently be able to cater for more customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en: Akbari is 41-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business making and selling crackers. She is an expert at making good tasting crackers at home and she sells them to the people of her locality. She earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase stock of gram flour along with packs of oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Ella tiene 18 años su nombre es  Sandra patricia,  vive con los padres los tres hermanos y la sobrina, la madre es ama de casa, el padre vigilante, el mayor de los hermanos está desempleado, la hermana trabaja de vendedora y el menor es estudiante.
A estudiado en colegio distrital, salió bachiller el 2012, se graduó con ceremonia del colegio, en el  colegio conoció la institución CAMPO ALTO,  inicialmente ella quería estudiar enfermería pues no conocía muy bien los programas, al dirigirse a la institución conoció las formas de pago y los programas,  le intereso HOTELERIA Y TURISMO debido a lo laboral y porque siempre le ha interesado el servicio al cliente, conocer lugares, historia sobre muchos sitios históricos.
Ella quería empezar a estudiar desde el principio del 2013 pero debido a la situación económica de la familia no pudo, ya que los padres son responsables de la sobrina y además pagan un centro de rehabilitación para el hermano mayor,  por este motivo ella decidió inscribirse a el convenio kiva para obtener un descuento y sea más flexible el pago, ya que ella no ha podido trabajar porque cuida a la sobrina por las tardes.
Sandra entra el 2014 a segundo semestre de hotelería,  el primer semestre le fue bien ya que es una mujer muy responsable, dedicada, respetuosa e inteligente,  aprendió muchas cosas en este semestre y le ha gustado mucho esta institución.
texts.en:
This is Sandra Patricia; she is 18 years old and lives with her parents, three siblings and her niece. Sandra's mother is a housewife, her father, a security guard, and the eldest sibling is unemployed. Sandra's sister is a saleswoman and the youngest sibling is a student.

Sandra studied at the local school. She finished at Campo Alto High School in 2012, graduating at a school ceremony. At first Sandra wanted to study nursing but she did not really know what study programmes were on offer. After visiting the school where she studies and learning about the programmes and costs, Sandra became interested in tourism and hospitality, because of the work and because of her interest in customer service, in learning about new places and histoty and learning about historic sites.

Sandra wanted to start her studies at the beginning of 2013 but, due to her family's financial situation, she could not do this. Sandra's parents have to support her niece and also have to cover the costs of her eldest brother's stay at a rehabilitation centre. As a result, Sandra decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to obtain a discount and to have a more flexible payment system as she cannot work due to the fact that she looks after her niece in the afternoon.

In 2014 Sandra is starting her second semester of hospitality. Her first semester went well as she is a responsible, dedicated, respectful and intelligent woman. She learned many things during this first semester and really likes her school.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for one semester.

loans.name: Mayai Leikai Shg Group

texts.en:
“The reward of labour is life,” is what her in-laws taught Romila.  She also believes in the dignity of labour. She is married to a lorry driver and she also runs a variety shop in the neighbourhood. Mayai Leikai SHG Group was formed by eight hard-working women living in the same neighbourhood. All the eight women are economically active and financially independent. They all support their families by engaging in income-generating activities like weaving, tailoring and small businesses. Romila lives in a village which is about 30 kms from state capital of Manipur and also one of the North-Eastern states in India.

Romila quit weaving and starting running a variety shop in the courtyard of her house, facing the roadside which connects the neighbourhoods. She sells all essential goods and daily-use items like edible oils, a variety of cereals, bar soaps, detergent powders, candles, kerosene, shampoo and locally made delicacies. Generating income by weaving was unreliable because one can only earn in accordance with the demand of the customer and capability of the weaver. Therefore she opened the shop to earn on a daily basis and generate a regular income.

With the help of the Kiva loan, she will purchase more supplies to sell. She will buy a sack of rice, wheat flour and other goods. She will also start selling fresh vegetables as that is the main demand for the neighbourhood. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva". She and the rest of the group members will always be grateful for the unconditional support and co-operation. The other group members are engaged in weaving.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for the variety shop, sell them, and generate regular income

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is successfully running a small general store with the support of her husband. She offers various things of daily use, such as shampoos, lotions, cleaning products, and grocery items. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts during the years. 

Zahida is a mother of three children and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Zahida wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of detergents, soaps, and shampoos, along with stocks of grains. This will help her to meet the demands of her customers, time after time. 

She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of detergents, soaps, and shampoos, along with stocks of grains.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en:
Jamali is 45 years old and married. She operates a business selling milk, which she has been doing for many years. She has two buffaloes and three goats, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit.  Jamali has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Jamali has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is requesting her sixth loan for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. Jamali is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem, age 36, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Humera

texts.en: Humera is a 46-year-old married lady who is running a small shop where she sells cloth and dressmaking materials, such as lace, thread, buttons, etc. She has been doing this for the past 10 years in her community. By this time she has retained many customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan for PKR 50,000, which she will use to buy spools of thread along with packs of lace, ribbons, and buttons in different colors. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread along with packs of lace, ribbons, and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She, along with her husband (who is also shown in the photo), has been in the business of selling artificial jewelry for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Nargis is actively helping her husband, as this business is the only source of income for them. They have four children. The couple wishes to provide them with a better living standard by trying to increase their earnings. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Nargis requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stock of rings, earrings and bracelets in various colors and designs. She hopes to get an increase in their net income through her larger sales and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rings, earrings and bracelets in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 31-year-old married woman. She has had a business selling used clothes in her community for many years.  She buys clothes in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Zareena is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of used clothes in different sizes and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of used clothes in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 45 years old. He is married with two daughters, ages eight and ten years old. Benard runs his own business, which provides financial services such as mobile money transfers, bill payments, and selling airtime credit to his community. The business helps him provide for his family and send his two daughters to school. 

Benard has a very positive outlook. He spends the day at his mobile money transfer shop. He enjoys his business because he interacts with different people every day, and is happy that he offers a needed service to his community. He and his wife are not in formal employment; the business is their only source of income.  

Bernard’s business is located in a very busy area of Kasama town. His main challenge is low working capital; sometimes he has to turn down customers because he does not have enough cash to pay them out. 

It is for this reason he  has requested a Kiva loan. The loan will help him boost his working capital so that he can serve more customers in need of financial services and earn additional income to support his family.

loans.use: To add to the money so he can serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 45-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small simple house in the city.  For the past four years, Alaa has been working in a small shop selling clothes.  It is a good project and earns a good income. Alaa would like to improve his business and maybe in the future open a bigger store. 

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more clothes for his store to resell.  By taking this loan, Alaa's sales will increase and also his income.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his store to resell.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 43-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and seven kids (four sons and three daughters) in a small simple house in the city. For the past fifteen years, Ayman has been working in a small shop selling clothes. It is a good project and earns a good income. Ayman would like to improve his business and maybe in the future open a bigger store. 

Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more clothes for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Ayman's sales will be increased and also his income. Ayman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his store to resell

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma. Aida is a married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through selling homemade snacks like binoylos (fried dough sprinkled with sugar) and bread. 

Ma. Aida has been in the business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy flour, baking powder and oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Ma. Aida hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder and oil.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 62 years old, married and blessed with eight children. To earn a living, she engaged herself in the transportation business using her motorcycle and mini sari-sari store. Her husband helps her to manage their businesses. Lourdes has been in this business for two years. This time, Lourdes is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle, and some amount will be used in buying grocery items to re-stock her sari-sari (variety) store.She is hoping that she will be able to improve her business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle, and grocery items for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho is a 63-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 25 years to 40 years. She describes herself to be focused. 

Recho operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of a permanent place for doing business.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 8 years. They are both going to school. She has three additional dependants who live with her to assist her in the business. In 2007, Kadiatu established her business of selling sets of pans, dishes, bowls, spoons, flasks, glasses, plates, cups, knives and pots, etc. She began her business because she dropped out of school as her parents did not value girls' education. She instead used to assist her mother in business.  

When Kadiatu got married, her husband gave her initial capital to start a business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy sets of pans, dishes, and bowls. 

Kadiatu has not got a strategically located shop, but her building house is on-going.
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sets of pans, dishes, and bowls.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She sells garments and other items to the people in her community, and has been in this business for three years. 

She is a married woman and her husband is a fisherman. Monaliza works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy more garments to sell and new fishing nets for her husband. She dreams of improving her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future use and to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more garments to sell and new fishing nets for her husband.

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: La cliente Irène est un officier des opérations de terrain dans une organisation de société civile. Elle est parent d’élèves inscrits régulièrement à l’école primaire. Elle a été informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et souhaite les voir  devenir des ingénieurs informaticiens, médecin, cadre d’entreprise, professeur d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, elle salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Irène, is a field operations official in a government organization. She is the parent of children regularly signed up for school, and she was informed about new opportunities in education loans that the microfinance institution Hekima is offering for financing in advance the costs of schooling. 

This new loan will thus serve to pay the education costs of her children, so that they are no longer excluded from classes during the entire 2013-14 school years. This parent dreams of a better future for her children and would like to see them become computer engineers, doctors, company managers, university professors, pastors, parliamentarians, etc. 

In conclusion, she recognizes in a big way Hekima's special initiative, especially this social impact plan during this period of reconstruction in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for vehicle insurance and pay one staff member.

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Karibushe est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Safi», entrepreneur, âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui  tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des planches de constructions. Elle stocke sa marchandise dans un dépôt des périphéries de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 100 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Karibushe, is a merchant and a member of the business association "Safi". She is 28 years old, an entrepreneur, and a married mother of four children, all in school. This client sells construction lumber. She stocks her merchandise in a warehouse in a suburb of the city. She started her business with help from her husband, who is also a merchant. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for four years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 100 boards. Thus, she would like to expand her plans, build a house, and provide education, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy for unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time post-conflict in the country's east. It should be noted that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase 100 boards for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water and rice for her business.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is a 33-year-old married woman, who lives in the Marneuli district. She has already had two children and now she is expecting her third baby. Oksana's husband runs agricultural activities and generates an income of 400 GEL per month. In the early years, he was also involved in the trading business.  He was buying clothing at wholesale prices and then realized it for a good price. However, the job was hard for them as they didn't have their own place for selling the purchased clothing.  Oksana has just found the mentioned place and requested a loan for working materials. The Start Up program which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo allows the rural poor, like Oksana, to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. She requested a loan of 2,600 USD to purchase stock of baby clothing and begin trading. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program, Oksana will be able to earn savings and provide a better future for her baby.

loans.use: To purchase stock of baby clothing and begin trading

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Misael Alexander

texts.es:
Misael de 21 años de edad,  estudió hasta sexto grado debido a la pobreza, y que su papá murió cuando él tenía 12 años y le tocó que ayudarle a su mamá en la agricultura para sostener a sus otros 3 hermanos que quedaban mas pequeños, está soltero y vive con su mamá y sus 3 hermanos. 


Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 10 años y fue su papá quien le enseñó el trabajo, además de la agricultura él se dedica al comercio vende pescado, compra y venta de gallinas, tienen con su mamá un destazo y él vende la carne, también le gusta cuidar ganado, él se levanta a las 4:00  AM para ordeñar unas 4 vacas que tiene su mamá, luego las lleva al potrero y se queda trabajando con sus hermanos hasta las 12 del mediodía; luego regresa a casa a almorzar y por la tarde se dedica a vender ya sea pescado o carne.  


El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de semilla, abono y herbicidas para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz de riego.

Su sueño primeramente es pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas, además sueña con que su hermana estudie hasta graduarse en la universidad, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad, además sueña con comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa ya que hoy vive con su mamá y sueña con casarse.
texts.en:
Misael is 21 years old and completed only up to sixth grade at school. as his family was poor and his father died when he was twelve years old. This meant that Misael had to help with the agricultural work in order to support his three younger siblings. Misael is single and lives with his mother and three siblings.

Misael has been working in agriculture for the past ten years, his father having taught him the trade. In addition Misael sells fish, buys and sells hens and, with his mother, he owns a slaughterhouse and Misael sells the meat from there. Misael also likes looking after cattle. He gets up at 4am in order to milk four cows, which his mother owns. He then takes them to the pasture and he stays to work with his siblings until 12 noon. Misael then returns home to work selling either meat or fish.

This loan will be used to buy seeds, manure and weed-killers in order to sow corn on 7000 square metres of land.

Misael's first dream is to pay off his goal and to be free from his debt. He also dreams of his sister completing university as he himself did not have this opportunity. In addition, Misael dreams of buying a plot of land and building his own house as he currently lives with his mother. Misael dreams of getting married, too.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and weed-killers in order to sow corn on 7000 square metres of land.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado debido a la separación que hubo de sus padres y se fue a vivir con su papá y su abuelita y luego que murió su abuelita se quedó solo con su papá, un año mas tarde murió su papá también y quedó sola y le tocó que dejar la escuela para trabajar y poder ganarse la comida.
