Está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene unos 10 años, pues su papá siempre la llevaba al trabajo y fue él quien le enseñó, hoy le agradece a su padre el haberle enseñado a trabajar, además tiene una pequeña granja de pollos y de cerdos, también tiene 3 terneros. Ella se levanta a las 4:00 AM para prepararle el desayuno a sus hijos que se van al trabajo, luego alimenta a sus pollos y cerdos para después ir a dejar su ganado al potrero donde camina 30 minutos; luego se va donde sus hijos para verificar su trabajo en la agricultura y regresa a casa para atender la granja y su familia.   

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de ganado, ya que es un medio para obtener ganancias, pues ya sacó la cosecha de invierno y el potrero quedó bueno para repastear ganado y quiere aprovecharlo.

Su sueño es poder pagar el crédito, además sueña con comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, ya que en la que vive actualmente no es de ella, sueña con tener una granja de pollos grande y unas 5 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and completed up to third grade at school. She only got this far in school as her parents separated and, after this, she went to live with her father and grandmother. María's grandmother later died and so she stayed with only her father. A year after her grandmother's death, her father also died, leaving María on her own. She had to leave school and start work and earning her food. María has a partner, who works in agriculture.

María has been working in agriculture for ten years. Her father always took her to work and taught her the trade. Today María is grateful to her father for teaching her this work. She also has a small farm with chickens, pigs, and three calves. María wakes up at 4am in order to prepare breakfast for her children who are going out to work. She then feeds her chickens and pigs in order to then take the cattle to the pasture, a 30 minute walk away. María then goes to see her children, to see how they are getting on with the agriculture work, before returning home to look after the farm and family.

This loan will be used to buy cattle as they are a way to earn profits. María has already collected the winter harvest. The pasture is in a good condition for the cattle to graze and so María wants to take advantage of this.

María's dream is to pay off her loan. She also dreams of buying a plot of land and building her own house as she does not own her current home. María dreams of having a big chicken farm and five dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 45 years old. He is married and has four children, aged 9, 13, 17, and 19. Three of his children attend school. 

In 1998, Ibrahim established his used clothing (house dressings) business. He began his business because he was in school when his father died. As a result, he went to live with his older sister and joined his brother-in-law's business. Ibrahim stayed with them for several years before he set up his own business.  

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, Ibrahim earns about SLL 1050,000 every month from this business. Ibrahim has improved his business and standard of living and would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 to purchase bales of house dressings.

He hopes to complete his unfinished building and wants to acquire more loans in order to purchase large amounts of stock. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of house dressings.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Ella es sandra milena es estudiante de cosmetologìa y estética integral del instituto campo alto y mama de dos niños.
Cuando era pequeña su sueño siempre era tener su empresa propia para salir adelante y comprarle una casa a la mama, ya que cuando eran pequeños la casa en la que vivían no era muy cómoda, ni amplia tampoco había agua potable y tocaba cargarla en burro.
Con el hermano cargaban el agua para poder obtener dinero para comer, se dio cuenta que para empezar a ser su sueño realidad necesitaba empezar con el estudio, a si que busco los recursos para terminar su bachillerato y recibió una beca para estudiar los fines de semana y por ser madre adolescente le colaboraban cuidando al niño en el mismo colegio donde estudiaba. 
Hace dos años estaba con un proyecto de sacos de lana, el cual tejían personas en condición de discapacidad, todo estaba marchando de maravilla, tenían un contrato muy bueno, pero en la casa de sandra hubo un incendio que consumió TODO, no quedaron maquinarias con que seguir trabajando.
Actualmente se encuentra estudiando los domingos ya que entre semana se encuentra buscando trabajo, pero de lo que ella esta segura es que apenas termine su carrera tendrá su propio centro de estética. 
Sabe que al crear su propia empresa va a dar ayuda a muchas mujeres e incluso familias al poder brindarles un trabajo digno.
Por lo anterior mencionado sandra pide a kiva el convenio para que pueda terminar la carrera y tener por fin su propio centro de estética.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena is a student of cosmetology and integral aesthetics at the Campo Alto Institute in Bogota.  She is also the mother of two children.

When she was very young, she dreamed of having her own business so that she could get ahead and purchase a home for her mother.  When she was growing up, the house in which they lived was not very comfortable.  It was not very large and did not even have potable water, so they had to carry water home by donkey.

With her brother, they transported water for others in order to earn money to put food on the table.  She realized that in order to make her dream a reality she would need to go to school.  Thus, she began searching for resources to enable her to earn her high school diploma.  She received a scholarship to study during the weekends, and being a teenage mother, the school helped her to care for her son while she was studying.

Two years ago she was working under a program in which disadvantaged workers have the opportunity to spin yarn from wool. She had very good contract - everything was going very well.  However, her house then burned down and she lost everything, including the machines she needed in order to continue working.

Currently she is in school on Sundays, since she spends the entire week looking for work.  However, one thing of which she is certain is that soon after finishing her studies she will have her own beauty shop.

She knows that creating her own business will help many women and their families as it will bring them the opportunity for dignified work.  With this in mind, she is seeking a loan through Kiva to assist her in completing her education so that she can at last open her own business.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Alizbeth

texts.en:
Alizbeth is 32 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a plumber, which he has been doing for many years. He provides all the income for the family. He provides the services for underground piping connections, fitting of taps, and digging wells. He retains a list of good customers and his business is doing well. 

Alizbeth's husband's tools have been wearing out and he wants to buy new tools such as wrench, tube cutter, pipe threader, tube flaring, soldering torch, tile spade, shovel, digging bar, etc. to continue his services. Alizbeth requested a loan for her husband from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy tools for his plumbing business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for digging wells and plumbing.

loans.name: Marleny Yamileth

texts.es:
Marleny de 36 años de edad,  actualmente es ama de casa;  quien culmino sus estudios de bachillerato, una mujer luchadora y emprendedora quien a sacado a sus 2  hijos adelante, se volvió a acompañar hace 3 años, ya que era viuda su pareja se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando.  	

	
El crédito será utilizado,  una parte en el mejoramiento de la vivienda y el resto en la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos que tiene junto a su actual compañero de vida.  


A futuro le señora,  quiere que sus hijos logren culminar sus estudios académicos y con el apoyo de su actual pareja lograrlo, inculcándoles valores, para que puedan salir adelante y aconsejarlos de que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Marleny is 36 years old and is a housewife. She completed high school and is a feisty and enterprising woman, who has helped her two children to get ahead. Marleny was a widow but found a new partner three years ago. Her partner grows basic grains and her children are in school.

Part of this loan will be used to improve Marleny's home; the rest will be used to bring the basic grains harvest, which Marleny owns with her partner.

In the future, Marleny would like her children to finish their studies and, with the support of her partner, to instil good values in them, so that they can prosper and become good people.

loans.use: to invest in improving her house and to pay for the harvesting of basic grains, which she owns with her partner.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and high-quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a 35-year-old married woman who has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries).  At present, she has three goats and three buffaloes. She also sells milk to the people of her community to raise an extra amount of income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Tasawar

texts.en: Tasawar is a31-year-old married woman. She has had a business selling animals for the past 10 years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries).  She also deals in the business of selling milk to generate an extra amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar, age 32, has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another calf

loans.name: Elbek

texts.ru: Элбек добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 33 лет. Он женат и очень любит свою семью. Живёт он в сельской местности. Чтобы прокормить свою семью Элбек занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь, где он выращивает некоторую сельхозкультуру и пасёт своих скот. Элбек сотрудничает с Арванд уже долгое время и является ответственным клиентом. На сегодня у Элбека имеется 7 голов скота, которых он выращивает. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Элбек хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Но у него на данный момент не имеется достаточная сумма денег для закупа скота. Поэтому  он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Элбек заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Elbek is a kind and happy 30-year-old man.  He is married and loves his family very much.  He lives n a rural area.  Elbek is involved in his own business to support his family.  He is involved in farming and animal husbandry.  He has land, where he grows agricultural crops and uses it for pasture for livestock.  Elbek has been working with Arvand for a long time and is a responsible client.  Today, Elbek has 7 heads of livestock that he is raising.  The animal husbandry business yields him a good income, and this is why Elbek wants to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount.  At the present time, he does not have enough money to buy livestock.  This is why he came to Arvand to obtain a loan and buy livestock.  Elbek thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes very much for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 24-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for a period of about six years. She has two cows for milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. She also deals in the business of selling animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to earn much more to meet her household expenditures including food, clothing, and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more cow to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Ibrahim. He is married, and has three children, aged 6, 4 and 4 months old. Two of his children attend school. He has three additional dependents who live with him, because they are his younger ones and he is assisting them in their schooling. They help to do some domestic work at home.

In 2005, Ibrahim established his soft drinks, hard drinks, energy drinks, biscuits, mobile phones & accessories business. He began his business as he used to assist his father in business after school. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 2,200,000 every month from this business. Ibrahim would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 to purchase some drinks, pure water and mobile phones and accessories. 

Ibrahim has started buying building material from the profits from his business, though he was not able to open another outlet because of inadequate capital. In the future, Ibrahim plans to start his building project as business improves. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase some drinks, pure water and mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Adama. She is married to a businessman, and has two children aged 9 and 5 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to attend school and also help with domestic work. 

In 2006, Adama established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business because she did not have anyone to help her continue her education because her parents are poor. She stated selling doughnut cakes. She saved Le 700,000 then changed her business into foodstuffs on a small scale, and she has improved over one year into a larger business. Adama has built the house and is currently living in it.

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  

Adama has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase a lot of goods that are of great demand, such as Irish Potatoes, onions, eggs, milk, tinned tomatoes etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her existing business.
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of goods that are of great demand, such as Irish Potatoes, onions, eggs, milk, tinned tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 44-year-old married woman with five children, living in Masindi, Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop in a market stall. She mainly started this business to earn income and be able to provide for her family. However, she faces challenges of competition and inadequate capital to expand her business. Her dream is to transform her retail business into a wholesale shop.
  
Fridah intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is from Yerevan. She lives there with her husband, 17-year-old daughter, son and father-in-law. Her son, Aramayis, is a student at the Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture. Lusine and her husband work hard to sustain the family's living and provide them with appropriate living conditions. Because of current financial difficulties, Lusine is unable to pay for her son's university tuition. She has asked for this loan to be able to pay for Aramayis's education and give him an opportunity to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny trabaja en una compañía donde producen ceramica de ladrillo . Él y su esposa y  junto al grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales. La esposa se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El vive en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas.

El sueño de Jhonny  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos, a la vez tener establos atemperados y ordeñadoras. Por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonny works for a company that makes ceramic tiles.  He and his wife and some other people from the community decided to care for the land and animals.  His wife raises dairy cows which she sells to some industrial milk plants.  Her first step was not to tie the cows up, nor keep them locked up, or keep them away from the pastures, not cutting off their horns so that they can have calves naturally and so that the food they produce is of high quality and so they stay healthy.

He lives with his in-laws in the Pallina Chico community in the Viacha sector of the Ongavi province, within the La Paz department.  He has several heads of cattle.

Jhonny’s dream is to increase his number of heads of cattle, while keeping them healthy, and have good stables so he can milk the cows.  He is asking for a loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase his milk production and income.

This will be his first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Iorami

texts.en:
Iorami is a 26-year-old man, who lives in Gori city. He has only a disabled brother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. 

Iorami is a distributor in a private company and, monthly, he generates GEL 400. He has just rented a place for a general store and he has requested a loan for working capital. 

His request has now been approved within the framework of an initiative between Kiva and Credo and he is able to use the start-up loan to set up the general store, located in the center of the town. The loan of USD 3,500 will help Iorami to purchase a stock of merchandise, such as groceries and household goods. 

After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expanding the business in the future. Iorami relies on the goodwill of the lenders and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de détails(couches, habits pour bébé, produits cosmétique...) depuis 2000, madame Yawa âgée de 41ans se bat chaque fois pour donner le meilleur d'elle même à son enfant de 19ans scolarisé. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle souhaiterait stocker plus de marchandises afin de garder ses clients. Le second crédit lui servira d'acheter des produits cosmétiques, des habits pour bébé et des couches... Elle espère devenir grossiste et aider son enfant à mieux s'épanouir.
texts.en: Yawa has worked reselling retail products since 2000 (diapers, baby clothing, cosmetics). She is 41 years of age, and constantly strives to give all she can to her 19-year-old child, who is at school. As the end-of-year holidays are approaching, she would like to stock up so that she can continue to satisfy her customers. Yawa will use her second loan to buy cosmetics, baby clothing and diapers. She hopes to become a wholesaler, as well as to help her child to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy diapers, baby clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Noemy pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  51 años de edad, asalariada trabajadora del estado, de ingresos bajos. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman ella y  su  hijo que es menor de edad.
La Sra. Noemy se desempeña como docente de educación primaria en un colegio público del municipio de Niquinohomo, con experiencia en la docencia de 18 años.  
Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema sanitario económico que consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema de tratamiento que consiste (un tanque biodigestor, caseta interna y externa, ducha lavamanos un pozo de absorción), esto lo requiere  ya que por donde ella habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familia cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Noemy tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. Con su bajo salario es imposible que logre instalar, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Noemy lives in Niquinohomo, a town selected to participate in an alliance program to improve local sewage infrastructure in Nicaragua. She is married, 51, a government employee, and low-income individual. Noemy teaches at an elementary school in Niquinohomo and has 18 years of experience. 

She is applying to the water and sanitation project through a loan to install a low-cost sewage system that comprises a conventional toilet and treatment system, including a biodigestor tank, internal and external housing, shower, sink, and absorption well. This is necessary because there isn't access to black water in her neighborhood; therefore her family has a latrine. Hers is one of thousands of families lacking an adequate sewage system. This project will benefit several towns in the country, will improve her family's living conditions, and will help the environment.
 
Noemy cannot buy a toilet without this loan because it is too expensive. Her low wage makes it impossible for her to install the toilet. These programs are designed to help impoverished families. Latrines are unhealthy and contaminate the environment; the program was designed to provide solutions for the poorest sectors.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sand, stone grit, cement, blocks, iron, gravel, toilet, and parts to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil to increase her business

loans.name: Honeylin

texts.en:
Honeylin is a married mother of two children from Talbion, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for five years now. This is the source of her income.
 
Honeylin is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets. With the help of this loan, her husband will be able to have a good catch which they can sell to the people in their place. In the future, Honeylin hopes to expand her business and to continue to meet the needs of her family. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown up children.

Virginia and her husband are engaged in fishing to support their family. She is asking for a loan to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat. With this, she can be assured of continued business in fishing. Her income provides food and school fees for her family. In the future, Virginia hopes of improving their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 2-year-old daughter. 

Argie operates a sari-sari store where she sells various items, such as cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, shampoos and soaps. She has been operating this retail store for almost five years. Argie requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy various items like soft drinks and dried goods like noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries to attract more customers. 

In the future, she would like expand her retail store business and save money for the future schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy various items like soft drinks and dried goods like noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries to attract more customers.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 50-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 to 28 years old. She describes herself as a risk-taker. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a place with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be stable. She also owns dairy cows which produce milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as oil, maggi cubes and salt for her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a married man from Talibon, Bohol. 

He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells items such as coffee, shampoo, sugar and canned goods. Eduardo also works as a carpenter. 

Eduardo requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell, like noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, and tools for carpentry, like a hammer. In the future, Eduardo would like to expand his business to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, like noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, and tools for carpentry, like a hammer.

loans.name: Chandrina

texts.en:
Chandrina is a married woman with three children from Talibon, Bohol.

She has been operating a sari-sari or variety store business for eight years now. She usually earns about 6,000 Php per month. Her husband is a fisherman, and this is the main source of their income.

Chandrina needs a loan for additional capital to be used in her business. Through this loan, she will be able to buy additional stock items for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. In the future, Chandrina wants to expand her store and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock items for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Marcelinda

texts.en:
Marcelinda is a farmer in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 57 years old, married and has seven adult children. She has been farming corn and rice for 30 years now, together with her husband. She is also engaged in a fishing and crab-catching businesses. These are the sources of their income. 

Marcelinda would like to improve her income by improving her fishing activity. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and crab traps which will enable her to be more productive and to catch more crabs. Her profit will allow her to buy nutritious food for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and crab traps which will enable her to be more productive and to catch more crabs.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a merchant, living in the town of  Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her locality. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Kimberly is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, dry goods, and toiletries, and materials for fishing, like nets, hooks, and buckets. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks, thus attracting more buyers. Her husband will also be able to improve his daily catch. 

Kimberly dreams of expanding their ventures in order to generate more income necessary for the needs of the family and for the schooling of their four young children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari and to buy additional materials for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken feet and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jihan Group

texts.en: Jihan Group is made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood in Hodiedah, Yemen. They requested a loan of 100,000 YER as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. Fatima is a 38-year-old, married woman and has children. She has been operating an incense sales business for five years.  This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense and perfumes for resale. In the future, she plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol and a mother of five children.

She has been raising pigs for more than four years now. This is the source of her income.

Ester is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs, so they can grow healthy, and an additional piglet to raise, so that she could sell them on-time. 

In the future, Ester would like to expand her pig-raising business, to improve her livelihood status and also to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and an additional piglet to raise.

loans.name: Menday

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Menday. He is married.  

In 2010, Menday established his business selling clothing, such as polo shirts, shoes, shirt, jeans, sandals, belts, bags, coats, etc. He began his business because he is a graduate but decided to go into business because of the struggle in getting a job in the country. His father gave him some amount of money to start business. 

Working seven days a week and fifteen hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He now travels to Guinea to buy his stock but has been unable to open another outlet because of financial constrains.

Menday would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL to buy jeans, polo shirts and shoes. He hopes to open another outlet. Inadequate capital is his main challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, polo shirts and shoes for his clothing business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadiatu. She is married, and has two children aged 5 years old and 18 months old. One is a school-going child. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they are fostered. 

In 2006, Kadiatu established her household utensils business. She began her business because although she completed tertiary education and taught for two years, the low salary she got made her decide to engage in business. The business has now grown from a stall to a shop. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,850,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bowls, set pans, ceramic cups and plates, stoves, glass bowls and cups, cool-mans and drinking buckets. 

Kadiatu has started traveling to Guinea Conakry, has a bigger shop space, acquired land, and bought some building materials. She is a hardworking and devoted businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bowls, set pans, ceramic cups and plates, stoves, glass bowls and cups, cool-mans and drinking buckets.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar unos novillos de engorde, con la finalidad de engordarlos y venderlos con un peso adecuado, la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Alexander is an enterprising 42 year old man.  He is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He is asking for a loan to buy some steers so he can fatten them up and sell them when they reach an optimal weight.  He depends on this activity to be able to get ahead financially, so he is asking for a loan.  This will be his first through FUDECOSUR.  He doesn’t have any other loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with ease and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 32-year-old married father of four living in Masindi, Uganda, is a farmer who grows maize and beans on a large scale. After looking for white collar jobs and failing, he opted to farm upon realizing that agriculture is the backbone of the Ugandan economy and has a readily available market. Despite his progress, he is challenged by seasonal changes and seasonal income. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to pay workers to weed his garden. He has the goal of starting up a retail shop for his wife to help improve their general well being.

loans.use: to pay workers to weed his garden.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Rosario tiene 37 años y dos hijos de las edades de 12 y 7 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de San Simon de la ciudad de La paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Señora Rosario va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que se acerca la época de Navidad y desea comprar también panetones, la Señora Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Rosario, 37, has two children, ages 12 and 7.  She makes a living selling staple items in her neighborhood store located in her home in the San Simón area of the city of La Paz.

This is Rosario's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store for the upcoming Christmas season.  She also wants to buy panettone.

The challenge Rosario faces in her business is competition, because there are a lot of neighborhood stores in the area.

She's going to use the profits to keep on buying merchandise to increase her capital.  One of her desires is to have a department store.  She feels happy and is grateful for this opportunity she's being offered.

loans.use: to buy panettone

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa is a married woman and a mother of six from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store that sells goods including sugar, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, and food supplements. This is the source of her income. Leonisa has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more stocks to sell (such as sugar, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, and food supplements). In the future, she would like to expand to promote her food supplement business and to gain more profit to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell (such as sugar, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, and food supplements).

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells goods such as coffee, canned goods, pouch vinegar, soy sauce, soaps, and toiletries. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for several years now. Emma is asking for a loan  to buy more goods to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, beverages, and condiments. In the future, Emma would like to expand her business to support her family and to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell (such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, beverages, and condiments).

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has six young children. She engages in a food-vending business. Her husband works as a tricycle driver. Zenaida sells homemade fried chicken to customers in the community. She has been selling fried chicken for several years now. Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy seasonings and chicken so that she can continue to serve her customers and also augment her income. In the future, Zenaida would like to expand her business to become a successful businesswoman while providing her children with good food and high-quality educations.

loans.use: to buy seasonings and chicken for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail store where he makes motor vehicle exhaust pipes for selling. He has been involved in this business for eight years. 

His business is located in a place with potential and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal sheets for making exhaust pipes.

His business goal is to diversify his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will advance himself through technology. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy metal sheets for making exhaust pipes.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has eight grown children. 

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items like biscuits, salted peanuts, coffee, cooking oil and noodles. She has been operating the retail store business for more than ten years now. 

Veronica is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, rice and corn, soap and toiletries, snack foods and other items to fill her store with stock. Veronica hopes that she can expand her retail store business to provide proper meals, and to set aside some money in preparation for her old age.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, rice and corn, soap and toiletries, snack foods and other items to fill her store with stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase materials such as lace, fabrics, thread and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes, sandals, slippers and full plastic black shoes to improve her business.

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es:
José Elmer tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el Caserío de Naranjos del distrito de Santo Domingo de la Capilla, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno desde hace diez años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de dos cabezas de ganado vacuno para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a mayor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is twenty-six years old. He lives in the town of Naranjos in the Santo Domingo de la Capilla District, a community that is known for its green landscapes. Its people work in agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is two hours from the Cutervo Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

José has been raising and selling cattle for ten years. He has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevos Soles to buy two heads of cattle to fatten up and sell at a higher price. In this manner, he can earn a greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a farmer living in Eldoret, a very rich area for agriculture.  He is married and has two children, all of school going age.  He has practiced farming for three years, his primary source of income being milk and eggs.  With farming, he enjoys feeding his livestock while his challenge comes from when he can't access processed dairy feed because it is expensive.

Elias chose Juhudi Kilimo through an outreach done by a loan officer and he realized that Juhudi's loans are at a low interest rate.  He also fell in love with Juhudi's mission of helping small scale farmers with income generating assets. Elias said this loan will help him support his family and provide most of their basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Humberto Isidro

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 35 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Humberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos organicos e inorganicos y fertilizantes . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas en los vende en el miso lugar.

El sueño es tener instalar un sistema de riego ya que existe escases de lluvia . En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 35 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  He lives with his spouse and their children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  

Humberto is a member of VRC ANCHOVETA, located in the Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The group is made up of agriculture workers.  

Humberto works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans.  He is seeking this loan to purchase seeds, organic and inorganic compost, and fertilizer.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make the purchases in Ventanas, where he also sells.  His dream is to install an irrigation system as there are rainfall shortages.  In his free time he enjoys relaxing and taking walks with his family.

loans.use: purchase seed, organic and inorganic compost, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Moraima

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos organicos e inorganicos y fertilizantes . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas en los vende en el miso lugar.

El sueño es tener instalar un sistema de riego ya que existe escases de lluvia . En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. She lives with her spouse and their children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

Maria is a member of VRC ANCHOVETA, located in the Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The group is made up of agriculture workers.

Maria works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans. She is seeking this loan to purchase seeds, organic and inorganic compost, and fertilizer. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. She will make the purchases in Ventanas, where she also sells. Her dream is to install an irrigation system as there are rainfall shortages. In her free time she enjoys relaxing and taking walks with her family.

loans.use: seeds, organic and inorganic compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes such as plates, bowls, pans, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, salt, onions, maggi cubes, and toothpaste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, onions, pepper, salt, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en: Giorgi is a 28-year-old married man from Gori city. He lives with his two school-aged sons and his wife who is a teacher and generates 200 GEL monthly. Giorgi is an experienced driver; he was working as a taxi driver with another person's car and was paying rent for the car. This money he paid was an important part of Giorgi's monthly income. Because of this he decided to apply for a loan and purchase his own car. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3,300 USD for purchasing a secondhand car. He will continue his activity and will save more money, as he wouldn't have to pay the rent anymore. Giorgi is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children have good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Giorgi is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase his own car and continue his taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, and sardines for her business;

loans.name: Khosamo

texts.ru: Хосамо разведенная женщина. Она развелась с мужем имея двух маленьких детей. Сейчас ее сыну уже 8 лет, а дочери 5 лет. Она очень любит своих детей и сама занимается их воспитанием и обеспечением. Хосамо по профессии швея. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем и в основном берет заказы на шитьё женских национальных платьев. Хосамо занимается данным делом на протяжении 3 лет. Хосамо в данный момент нуждается в кредите. Ее швейная машинка сломалась и она не может продолжить свою деятельность. На сумму кредита она хочет отремонтировать швейную машинку, а также купить профессиональный столик вместе со стулом для шитья.
texts.en:
Khosamo is a divorced woman. She and her husband divorced while having two small children. Currently Khosamo's son is 8 years and her daughter is 5 years old. Khosamo loves her children very much and takes care of their upbringing and provides for them by herself.

Khosamo is a seamstress by profession. She sews from her home and mainly takes orders for sewing women's national dresses. Khosamo has worked with this for a period of 3 years. Khosamo currently needs a loan. Her sewing machine was broken and she is not able to continue her business. She would like to use the loan amount to repair her sewing machine, and also to purchase a professional sewing table and chair.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and purchase a professional sewing table and chair

loans.name: Andres Eduardo

texts.es:
Andres tiene 21 años de edad es unido tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá con la conviviente y con la hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Anchoveta se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia puerto Pechiche recinto Anchovetala perteneciente al canton pueblo viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Andres se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos orgánicos e inorganicos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es tener dinero para comprar un riego que tanta falta le hace.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.

Nota: La ventanilla Bendicion de Dios se desintegro por tal motivo decidio ingresas a la Ventanilla Anchoveta.
texts.en:
Andres is 21 years of age, married, and has one daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter in Ventanas canton, De los Rios province. 

Andres is a farmer and belongs to “Anchoveta” communal bank, located in the parish house of Puerto Pechiche, Anchoveta district, in Pueblo Viejo canton.

Andres grows corn and rice. He is soliciting this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and organic and inorganic manures. With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the necessary inputs for his crops.

Andres makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to have the money to buy an irrigation system, the lack of which he feels so greatly.

The challenges he confronts are plant plagues. In his free time he likes to catch up on his sleep.

Note: The “Bendicion de Dios” communal bank has fallen apart and its members have decided to join the “Anchoveta” communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and organic and inorganic manures for his crops.

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is sells coconut wine, locally known as tuba, and coconut vinegar. Mary Ann has been selling coconut wine for three years to support her family. Coconut wine is fermented to be made into vinegar.

Mary Ann is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business and is requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine to resell in the community. The loan will enable her to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. 

Mary Ann dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable and of saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, bulk grains, cheese, vegetables and fruit for soft drinks.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman living in the town of  Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is 10.

Ma. Victoria engages in a retail business. She sells personal products, such as cologne and apparel, and beauty products, such as whitening lotion and face powder. Aside from retail, she also makes snack foods and sells them to nearby schools to provide additional income.

Ma. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks (such as body spray, soaps, and other beauty products). With this, she will be able to sell more products to her customers and augment her sales and income. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to expand both her businesses to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks (such as body spray, soaps, and other beauty products).

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines and earns a living by fishing. He has six grown children. Alfredo has been in the fishing business for over 10 years. 

Alfredo wants to improve his fishing business, so he is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other items. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch which he can then sell at the market.  

In the future, Alfredo would like to expand his fishing business to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Dionalie

texts.en:
Dionalie is married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dionalie is 26 years old and has one child who is in school.

Dionalie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional dry goods to sell. Dionalie has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Dionalie would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. 

She sells goods in her store, like powdered milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and soft drinks. She has been operating her business for almost three years. 
 
Ma. Ana has requested a loan to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, cooking materials, soap, and toiletries. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, cooking materials, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old, married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail shop, where she sells shoes. Her business is located in an area conducive for the business, and her primary customers are local residents.

She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of shoes. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of shoes

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married, with five children, two of whom are in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Narcilita

texts.en:
Narcilita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Narcilita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients, like spices, meat, and vegetables.

Narcilita has been in this business for 37 years now.

In the future, Narcilita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like spices, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a youth residing in Nairobi's Majengo area. He recently completed high school but hasn't entered college yet. He desires to own a business that will enable him raise funds for his college education and upkeep. 

Albert recently learned about the Fresh Life initiative and thought that investing in a Fresh Life franchise would be a great business opportunity since his area faces huge sanitation challenges. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to be located in his area. 

Albert hopes that the success of this franchise will help him fund his college education and improve the community standard of living by providing better sanitation facilities. He desires to expand his franchise in the future and to inspire more youth to take part in activities that benefit not only themselves but the communities they live in as well.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: German Elizardo

texts.es:
Germán, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hija de 8 años, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para llevar a su hogar lo necesario para que su familia este bien, se dedica a atender su tienda la cual abre a las 6:00 a.m. y la cierra a las 8:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderla.
Invertirá en la compra de bebidas azúcar, galletas, pan, jabón, etc. le ayudara a surtir su inventario, mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, espera fortalecer su negocio, atraer más clientes,  cancelar sus deudas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Sueña con tener un local más grande para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Germán lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and their 8 year old daughter.  He does not have outside help to provide the basic necessities for his family to live.  He dedicates himself to tending his store that opens at 6:00 am and closes at 8:00 pm.  To this day, he has never missed a day.  

He will use this loan to purchase beverages, sugar, cookies, bread, soap, etc.  This will allow him to stock his inventory, improve his sales, and increase his earnings.  He hopes to strengthen his business, attract more clients, cancel his debts and improve his family's living conditions.  He dreams of having a bigger store that offer a greater variety of products.

loans.use: purchase beverages, sugar, cookies, bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Gynna Patricia

texts.es:
Gynna tiene 34 años de edad es soletera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Gynna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos organicos e inorganicos y fertilizantes . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es tener dienro para salir de viaje y para comprar un regadio . En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Gynna is thirty-four years old. She is single and has three children. She and her children live in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province. 

She is a member of the "Anchoveta" communal bank. It's located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, Recinto Anchoveta, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo Canton where the people work in agriculture. 

Gynna works in agriculture; she grows corn, rice, and beans. She is applying for this loan to buy seeds as well as organic and inorganic fertilizers. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the necessary supplies for sowing her fields. She will make her purchases in Ventanas.

Her dreams are to have money to travel and buy irrigated land. In her spare time, she enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds as well as organic and inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en:
Manzoor is a 34-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk for the past three years. She has one calf and one cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Manzoor has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her milk production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zerina

texts.en:
Zerina is 46 years old, a married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zerina has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zerina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Halema

texts.en: Halema is a 52-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the feast of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu and palm nut to expand her business

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita runs a sari-sari (convenience store) at her place in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 30 years. This is the primary source of her income. 

As of this time, Virgincita is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods, and other snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. 

Virgincita dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods, and other snack foods

loans.name: Airesty

texts.en:
Airesty is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has six children. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in which she sells items like eggs, bread, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods. 

In addition to operating a convenience store, Airesty maintains a buying and selling business to gain additional income for her family. She buys and sells fish, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Airesty is asking for a loan to buy various fish and additional sweet potatoes and cassava to resell.

In the future, Airesty would like to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living and also to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sweet potatoes, and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven grown-up children. 

Margarita runs a sari-sari (retail store) business. She sells biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soaps, and shampoos. She has been operating a retail store for more than ten years. 

Margarita is asking for a loan  to buy various goods, like condiments, beverages and soaps.

In the future, she would like to expand her sari-sari store in order to provide her family with good living conditions and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various goods, like condiments, beverages, and soaps.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира 25-летняя молодая женщина. Она замужем и является матерью троих детей. У нее трое маленьких сыновей в возрасте 9 месяцев, 2 и 3 лет. Назира со своей семьей живет в районе Яван. Ее муж предоставляет услуги мастера по стройке домов, а также имеет 0,60 га участка сада, за которым ухаживает сам. А Назира занимается сельским хозяйством вот уже три года. Она выращивает зерновые культуры и овощи. Сейчас она проводит посев. Для этой цели Назира просит кредит, на сумму которого хочет приобрести качественные семена картофеля и зерна. В будущем за счет продажи с урожая, она хочет провести ремонт в доме и улучшить бытовые условия семьи.
texts.en:
Nazira is a 25 years old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Her three small sons are 9 months, 2 years and 3 years. Nazira lives in the Yavan region with her family. Her husband is a master carpenter and also owns 0.60 hectares of land which they cultivate themselves.

Nazira has worked with field crop cultivation for three years already. She grows cereals and vegetables. Currently she is sowing. With this aim, Nazira requets a loan, for which she would like to purchase quality potato and corn seeds. In the future, from the sale of the harvest, Nazira would like to carry out repair to her house and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase quality potato and corn seeds

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es casado, de 39 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos: 2 varones y 1 mujer, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Se dedica a la agricultura; esta actividad la heredó de sus padres. Realiza está actividad porque tiene mucha experiencia para hacerlo y  además es la fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Además de la agricultura, el se dedica a la prestación del servicio de transporte en la comunidad donde vive, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan su presupuesto familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de piso cerámico  
El sueño más importante de Juan es la remodelación total de su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 39-years old and has three children- two boys and a girl.  He lives with his family in Sololá.  Juan makes his living in agriculture, which he learned from his parents.  He pursues this line of work because he has a lot of experience in it.  Also, agriculture provides the income he uses to support his family. 
In addition to agriculture, Juan provides transportation services in his community.  That gives him another income to complement his family's finances. 
Juan is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 (USD $650) to purchase tile flooring.  
Juan's most important dream is to completely remodel his house to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tile flooring.

loans.name: Ana Cesibel

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona hogareña, vive junto a su esposo y sus padres, como apoyo económico para su familia ella se dedica a atender una tienda de productos de para el hogar y una pequeña librería. Lo posee desde hace 10 años y por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderlo.
Invertirá en la compra de pan, aceite, azúcar, papelería, plumones, tintas, cintas adhesivas, entre otros productos tanto para su tienda como para la librería, espera surtir de productos nuevos su inventario para tener mejor atendidos a sus clientes, aumentar ventas y mejorar las ganancias.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más grande y poder tener los recursos para cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Ana is a homebody who lives with her husband and her parents.  As a way of helping her family financially, she works tending a shop that sells household products, and a small bookstore.  She has owned the stores for 10 years, and has never had a problem taking care of it.  

She will use the loan to purchase bread, oil, sugar, paper products, markers, ink, and adhesive tape among other things for her home goods store and the bookstore.  She hopes to stock her inventory with new products in order to better serve her customers, increase her sales and improve her earnings.  She dreams of having a bigger business and the resources to cancel her debts.

loans.use: purchase bread, oil, sugar, paper products, markers, inks, adhesive tape

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica velar por el cuidado de su familia, vive junto a su compañera de vida y una hija, para generar los ingresos necesarios con los que cubre los gastos familiares se dedica a cultivar granos básicos (maíz y frijol), es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y hoy en día lo utiliza para sacar adelante a su familia.
Invertirá en la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol, le facilitara tener de una manera rápida tener la cosecha en su casa para entregar sus pedidos  a sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ganancias, tener más clientes y seguir mejorando su situación económica.
Espera ampliar su área de cultivo para aumentar su cosecha y contar con los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Santos watches over his family's city.  He lives with his wife and one daughter.  To generate the income he needs to cover his family's expenses, Santos grows basic grains (corn and beans).  It's a trade that he learned from his father and that he now uses to get his family ahead. 
Santos will invest in harvesting his corn and beans.  The loan will allow him to harvest more quickly, get the harvest to his house and deliver his customers' orders.  He hopes to increase his profit, have more customers and keep improving his financial situation. 
Santos hopes to expand his fields to increase his harvest and count on the income he needs to cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to harvest his corn and beans.

loans.name: María Karla

texts.es:
María Karla es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

María tiene 23 años y es soltera. Ella tiene una carrera técnica en Pediatría, por lo que había trabajado en algunas guarderías y como niñera particular durante un año; por las distancias a su hogar decidió dejar estos trabajos y adquirió su papelería, la cual tiene un año y cinco meses abierta. 

En su papelería María ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos necesarios para la escuela u oficina. Pide este préstamo para comprar más mercancía y tener siempre surtida su papelería.

Gracias al esfuerzo puesto en su papelería ha logrado adquirir un celular que necesitaba, contratar una terminal para poder cobrar con tarjeta y en general gozar de estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is a micro-entrepreneur who is a client of Kubo Financiero, and here is her story:

María is twenty-three years old and single. She has a technical degree in Pediatrics; therefore, she had worked at several daycare centers and also as a private nanny for one year. Due to the distance from her home, she decided to leave these jobs and acquired her stationery shop. She has had it open for one year and five months.

At her stationery shop, María provides her customers with all types of necessary items for the school or office. She is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise to always have her store stocked. 

Thanks to the effort that she has put into her store, she has managed to buy a cell phone that she needed, rent a credit card terminal to be able to charge credit cards, and enjoy financial stability in general.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Manuel Martin

texts.es:
Manuel es casado, de 49 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos: 2 varones y 5 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Se dedica a la construcción de casas (albañil) desde hace 25 años, inició este oficio como ayudante y todo el conocimiento lo adquirió de otras personas a las que ayudaba. Esta actividad es la que le genera los recursos económicos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de piso cerámico  
El sueño más importante de Manuel es la construcción total de su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 years old, married, and has seven children (two sons and five daughters).  He lives with his family in Sololá.  Manuel has been working in the house construction business as a bricklayer for 25 years.  He started in this line of work as an assistant and all of the knowledge that he acquired from other people has been a great help.  This business enables him to generate income for sustaining his family.  

Manuel is requesting a loan of 7,000 GTQ so that he can buy ceramic floor materials.  His most important wish is to complete the construction of his house so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase metal, aluminum sheets and other items.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is a married man, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. For more than ten years he has farmed seaweed for a living.

Hipolito is applying for a loan with which to buy straw, rope, and more seaweed seedlings. These will enable him to increase his harvest and augment his income.

In the future, Hipolito would like to expand his seaweed farming business, to improve his family's standard of living and to save for his son’s education.

loans.use: to buy straw, rope and more seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. 

Rosita has a sari-sari store business, where she sells items, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. In addition, she has also had a fishing business for 30 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. She hopes to expand her business and improve her profitability, so that she can better support her family, in terms of food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings.

loans.name: Vagaspamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Vegaspamba está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar tiene un clima frió y hermosos paisajes, su actividad principal es la crianza de animales y la agricultura. Las socias son personas amables, con sentido del humor y muy orgullosas de su cultura que sus padres les han inculcado, también se dedica a la elaboración de sogas, siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus hijos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, es una socia activa que se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Vegaspamba desde hace 6 años, en todo este tiempo los créditos le ha ayudado para mejorar su negocio.
La Señora. Zoila tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, 6 son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo de 4 años de edad pasa en casa, su esposo labora en la agricultura y la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Zoila desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y ganado, cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para su consumo y la venta, también se dedica a la realización de sogas lo que aprendió por habilidad. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar cabuya y abono para sus potreros. Su meta es de terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The Vegaspamba loan group is made up of 8 women who live around the Jadan en Cuenca parish.  This area has a cold climate and beautiful views.  The main economic activities are animal breeding and agriculture.  The members are friendly people, with a sense of humor and a lot of pride for the culture which their parents have instilled in them.  They also make ropes, and are always searching for a better future for their children.  

One of the members of this group is Zoila.  She is an active member who has been in the Vegaspamba group for 6 years.  In all of this time, the loans have helped her to improve her business.  Zoila is 55 years old, is married, and has 8 children, of which 6 are adults, are married, and live on their own.
