One of her children is in high school, and the last son, who is 4 years old stays at home.  Her husband works in agriculture, and they live in a house that they own.  

From a very young age, Zoila has raised chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle and cultivated her own land.  Whatever she grows, is for her own consumption and for sale.  She also makes ropes which she is skilled in.  The money from this loan will be used to purchase cabuya and fertilizer for her pastures.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: purchase cabuya and fertilizer.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for one year.

Melanie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Melinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and canned goods. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and canned goods

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, opta por un nuevo crédito para aprovechar estas fechas de fin de año que es cuando tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes comprara lociones, cremas, labiales, blusas, camisas, etc., lo que le dará la facilidad a sus clientes para elegir y comprar.
Con el crédito que se le otorgo antes ha podido fortalecer el negocio, aumentar ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos y mejorar su situación económica, su familia se encuentra saludable y viviendo en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana decided to take out another loan to take advantage of New Year season, which is when there is higher demand from her customers.  She will purchase lotions, creams, lipstick, blouses, tops etc.  This will give her customers more to choose from for their purchases. 
With the loan she was previously granted, Juana has been able to strengthen her business, increase her sales, have more satisfied customers and improve her financial situation.  Her family is healthy and living a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, lipstick, blouses, tops etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sonia Gricelda

texts.es:
Sonia, ha decidido invertir en la tienda para seguir atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes, comprara golosinas, pan, bebidas, sal, jabón, azúcar, entre otros, con esta inversión su negocio se verá fortalecido y sus clientes aumentaran.
Con el préstamo anterior su negocio se mantuvo fuerte y cumplió con las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentó las ventas, cancelo sus deudas y continúa trabajando para darle a su familia mejor alimentación y cubrir otros compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to invest in her store to continue providing excellent customer service.  She will purchase sweets, bread, beverages, salt, soap, sugar and other items.  With this investment, her business will be strengthened and she will earn more customers. 
With the previous loan, Sonia's business stayed strong and she met her customers' needs.  Her sales increased and she paid off her debts.  Sonia will continue working to give her family a better diet and cover other financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, bread, beverages, salt, soap, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Mahmarajab

texts.ru: Махмарачаб 54-летний житель района Яван. Он заботливый муж и отец пятерых детей. Махмарачаб пастух. Он вместе со старшим сыном занимается пастушеством. А его жена при дворе дома выращивает мелкорогатый скот для продажи. Махмарачаб помогает жене, куплю и продажу скота он производит сам. Махмарачаб и его семья занимается животноводством более 17 лет. Это их семейный бизнес и прибыль с бизнеса является основным источником дохода семьи. Чтобы увеличить поголовье скота, Махмарачаб обратился за кредитом. Он хочет закупить несколько голов мелкорогатого скота для развития их семейного бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mahmarajab is a 54 years old resident of the Yavan region. He is a loving husband and father of five children. Mahmarajab is a shepherd. Together with his eldest son he works with herding. His wife breeds sheep and goats for selling in the courtyard of their home. Mahmarajab helps his wife with purchasing and selling the livestock. 

Mahmarajab and his family has worked with livestock breeding for more than 17 years. This is their family business and the income from the business is one of the main sources of income for the family. In order to increase the number of cattle, Mahmarajab applied for a loan. He would like to purchase some sheep and goats to expand their family business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to develop his family business.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: El señor Wilder tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo que depende de sus ingresos, el cliente se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte como chofer, en  una línea de taxi trufi desde hace 2 años, mientras trabaja deja a su hijo con los padres de su concubina. Actualmente tiene muchas ganas de superarse y solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles y enseres para su hogar, para darle mayor comodidad a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Wilber is 26-years old.  He is single and has one dependent son.  He has made his living as a driver offering transportation services with the taxi line Trufi for the last two years.  While he works, Wilber leaves his son with his girlfriend's parents.  Right now, he has a great drive to improve his situation.  Wilber is requesting the loan to purchase furniture and household goods for his home so it will be more comfortable for his son and improve his son's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and household goods for his home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 44-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells groceries. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to clean water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy and educated family. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from four to twelve. He describes himself as committed. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and other crops. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are business people. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor weather. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs to enable him to plant more potatoes. His business goal is to increase his area of cultivation within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to create employment. This is his second loan with SMEP-DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., to expand her business,

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 12 to 23 years. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a butchery where he sells meat.

He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are local consumers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy more stock of meat to sell in his butchery. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to add stock of meat in his butchery. His business goal is to be able to sell in wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment and open more butcheries. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of meat in his butchery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods (coal, rice, onion, peppers, and oil) for her business,

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат жизнерадостный и общительный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. В юности он не смог получит высшее образование и специальность, так как его родители не имели возможности оплачивать его обучение. Поэтому Шавкат начал развивать в себе предпринимательские качества. Он начал пробовать разного вида торговлю и так получал доход. На сегодня он занимается стабильным бизнесом. Он продаёт канцелярские товары. Для этого у него имеется прилавок. Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, что помогает ему жить достойно. Но Шавкат сейчас желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы иметь больше покупателей для увеличения своей доходности. Но он не имеет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы осуществить закуп. Поэтому Шавкат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку канцелярских принадлежностей. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shavkat is a happy and sociable man of the age of 30 years. He is married and has children. In his youth, he was not able to receive higher education and specialization, as his parents did not have the possibility to pay for his education. Therefore, Shavkat started developing his entrepreneurial skills. He started trying different types of sales activities and got an income this way.

Currently Shavkat has a stable business. He sells stationary. He has a stall for this. This business brings him a good income, which helps him live in dignity. Shavkat would currently like to expand his assortment of goods, in order to get more customers and increase his income. He does however not have enough money to carry out the purchase. Therefore he turned to Arvand and wanted to get a loan to purchase stationary. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is a passionate Poblano farmer focused on providing for his family through what they grow. As is typical for small Mexican farmers, margins are tight and he does not turn a large profit. Despite that, the farm represents the family's primary income source and so Pablo is constantly looking to reduce his operating costs while maintaining or improving yields. He is investing in a 30 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove in order to save money, reduce the environmental impact of his farm, and to better use the abundant cow manure available on his farm. The biodigester will treat the animal waste through anaerobic digestion, generating clean-burning, renewable biogas and a potent biofertilizer. Pablo and his family will use the biogas to reduce their reliance on non-renewable propane in the kitchen and for heating bathwater; the biofertilizer will help him improve the soil quality of his terrain without having to spend on expensive, agrochemical fertilizers. Pablo's loan represents 50% of the total cost of his biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman and a mother of five children in Talibon, Bohol. She has operated a sari-sari or variety store business for more than nine years. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Gina needs a loan for the expansion of her business. 

For this reason, she joined CEVI to apply for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries. With this additional stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store. Ma. Gina hopes to expand her store in the future so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of three young children. She is engaged in raising hogs as a business. She has been raising pigs for almost six years. Aside from hog raising, she also grows rice to obtain additional income. 

As of now, Juana is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and an additional piglet to raise. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs which she can sell in the market. Juana hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and an additional piglet to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business for five years. This is the source of her income, with which she raises her children and provides for their daily needs. 

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, farm labor, and pesticides. Through this assistance, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Gloria hopes to make her farming business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, farm labor, and pesticides

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma works hard to support her family. Guilerma is a widow, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Guilerma requested a  loan through GDMPC to purchase fishing materials and more fish to sell in her fish stall. Guilerma has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Guilerma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is engaged in a sari-sari store (convenience store) business in the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman. 

While her husband is working as a driver, she is busy attending to her customers in her store. 

Elsa would like to expand her inventory by adding more merchandise to her store. Elsa is asking for a loan to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack foods. 

With this loan, Elsa will be able to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chicks, chickens, stock feeds, and feeders and to construct a bigger fowl run

loans.name: Chamukamuvhu Group

texts.en:
Janet is a mother of two, 25 years old, and the leader of the ladies' group Chamukamuvhu. She has done farming activities on her family plot since 2008 when she was married. She mainly grew maize and some sweet potatoes that have provided the source of food for her family. However, due to inconsistent rainfall patterns over the years, the returns from the fields are dwindling annually. While she would have tried venturing into tobacco farming to get more cash, as other communal farmers are doing, she cannot. She does not have a big plot and will therefore need to embark on intensive farming. She is starting tomato farming and getting a drip irrigation kit will help her manage the water supply she gets from a nearby well. The cash generated from the tomato farming will help provide cash to purchase food for her family as well as help her purchase a variety of seedlings to increase her horticultural farming venture. She hopes to be able to raise money to get her children into school as well as build an additional bedroom for them on her homestead.  

This group comes from Goromonzi, a farming area which is close to Harare, and are venturing into horticulture as it made business sense for them.  The group is made up of members between the ages of 23 and 32, with an average age of 26 years.  After their Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program training, they decided to carry out gardening on a commercial basis.  They have been doing their gardening since July 2013. The group members are mostly orphans and now have families of their own.  From the proceeds of their business they intend to raise an income for their families. They would like to request this loan to install a drip irrigation kit and to buy tomato and onion seedlings for their gardening venture.  The group plans to increase their farming area from 1 hectare to 5 hectares over the next 12 months.  They also want to work and ensure that all the group members have individual irrigation kits on their plots to increase their productivity rates. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations, where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources of additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy tomato and onion seedlings for their garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more apples to sell

loans.name: Germán

texts.en: Germán, a young dairy farmer from the high plains of Tlaxcala, earns his living from what his animals and land provide. It's not the most profitable field of work and Germán finds himself constantly looking for ways to improve his production process. His 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to do exactly that. The digester will convert some of the abundant cow manure produced everyday in his dairy into two valuable resources - renewable energy and biofertilizer. The biogas generated by the digester will allow Germán to reduce the amount his family currently spends on expensive and non-renewable propane to heat bathwater and cook. Germán will use the biofertilizer to improve his soils without having to spend more money on petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. The economic savings will improve the farm's business model and the environmental impact of his farm will be mitigated through both the displacement of fossil-fuel based fertilizers and fuel as well as improved treatment of the animal waste produced daily on his farm. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 57 años de edad, vive con esposa y su hijo en casa propia, Don Miguel  es un hombre  trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor desde hace 20 años se dedica a la  crianza y venta de ganado de engorde, adicional a eso también cultiva granos básicos. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir  en la preparación del terreno donde sea sembrar. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de otro buey  para poder trabajar mejor la tierra, Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Migues is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and their son in his own home. Miguel is a hardworking, responsible, and entrepreneurial man. 

For the past 20 years, he has made a living by raising and selling cattle. He also grows basic grains. He has a very good customer base because he has learned how to win the confidence of his customers. He offers high-quality products and good prices.

He has decided to invest in the preparation of land where he will grow crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase another ox so that he can better work the land. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing economic support to his home, which needs it greatly.

loans.use: to purchase a working ox.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de  58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, su nieta y su yerno, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old and live in her own home with her daughter, granddaughter and son-in-law. She owns a store where she sells a variety of basic needs products including beans, milk, eggs, and bread. Santos has had her business for many years and this has given her sales experience so that she can receive higher earnings. 

The store is located at her home, in an area that is highly trafficked. She is well-known by her neighbors in the area and has many customers. Santos keeps the store well-stocked. She would like to grow the business and make a new investment but she needs capital to do so. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store. She is certain that she will pay back her debt and trusts that it will give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, and bread.

loans.name: Camino A La Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 61 años de edad y nació en el distrito de Challabamba pues vive en el mismo distrito donde nacio y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. En esta oportunidad florencia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión). 

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Camino a la Excelencia” en la comunidad de Totora (La comunidad de Totora está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros.
texts.en:
Florencia is 61 years old and was born in the district of Challabamba. She now lives and works in the same district where she was born. She makes a living by raising small animals, like guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens. At this time, she needs a loan to purchase guinea pigs. 

The group members in general are thankful for the opportunity and promise to make their payments at the specified times. (The people who appear in the lower part of the photograph requested permission to miss this meeting).

A group of friends and neighbors formed the "Camino a la Excelencia" communal bank in the Totora community. (The Totora community is located in the Challabamba district, in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco.) This communal bank is made up of many people who are always looking for ways to move forward and, with their daily effort, provide a better future for their children. The members make a living in agriculture, fruit sales, food sales, grocery sales, livestock fattening, ranching, raising small animals, and other activities.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 36 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй живёт в маленькой деревне. Бахром очень много работает, чтобы кормить свою семью и удовлетворять все имеющиеся нужды своих детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры. Этим бизнесом он занимается вот уже более 9 лет и имеет в этом деле большой опят. Бахром имеет небольшой участок земли, где и выращивает свой урожай, такой как пшеница, лук,и другие овощи. А также чтобы иметь дополнительный доход, он выращивает и продаёт скот. У него имеется несколько голов скота. В ведении бизнеса Бахрому помогает его младший брат а также жена. Сейчас Бахром планирует заняться посевом, и для этого ему необходимо закупить семена. Для этого Бахром обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян для посева. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a good-natured and hardworking man of the age of 36 years. He is married and has three children. He lives in a small village together with his family. Bahrom works a lot in order to feed his family and meet all the needs of his children. He works with growing crops. He has been in this business for 9 years already, and has a large experience.

Bahrom has a small plot of land where he grows his crops, such as wheat, onion and other vegetables. He also raises and sells livestock to get an additional income. He has a few heads of livestock. Bahrom's wife and his youngest brother help him manage the business.

Currently Bahrom plans to do the sowing, so he needs to purchase seeds. For this he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase seeds for the sowing. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: María Edilma

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años de edad, 33 de ellos los ha dedicado a trabajar en el arte de la confección; aprendió de manera empírica, por medio de la observación, pues desde pequeña veía a su madre elaborar diferentes prendas, poco a poco se fue involucrando en el negocio y desde hace 26 años heredó el negocio de la madre, luego de afrontar el doloroso fallecimiento.
Actualmente María confecciona prendas de línea propia como camisas, vestidos, pantalones y otros, trabaja sola todos los días de 8 am a 6 pm y sus principales clientes son familiares, vecinos y amigos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos textiles al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes, satisfaciendo los diversos gustos, así podrá fidelizar a la clientela y mejorará los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su único interés es poder darle continuidad a su negocio, prestando el servicio a sus clientes, pues se siente bien con lo que tiene y manifiesta que gracias a su labor nunca le ha faltado nada.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and has worked for 33 years making clothing.  She learned the trade in a practical way, by means of observation.  From the time she was very young, she watched her mother make different types of clothing.  She eventually became more and more involved in the business, and 26 years ago she inherited the business from her mother, after facing the painful experience of her mother's passing.

Currently María makes her own line of clothing that includes shirts, pants dresses and other items.  She works on her own every day from 8 am to 6 pm, and her main customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

She will invest the loan proceeds in supplies such as cloth, thread, buttons and zippers.  This will enable her to offer a greater variety of styles and colors to her clients and satisfy their various preferences.  This will help her to gain the loyalty of her customers and to improve her income.  She says that her main priority is to ensure continuity in her business and provide service to her clients, which makes her happy.  She adds that thanks to her hard work, she has always had everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy textile supplies at wholesale, such as cloth, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has engaged in two businesses for the past 10 years: a sari-sari (convenience) store and a food vending business. Her husband is a tricycle driver. These activities are the sources of her income. At this time, Natividad is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store such as noodles, canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries as well as ingredients for food making such as flour, sugar, milk, and oil. In the future, Natividad hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store.

loans.name: Junerick

texts.en:
Junerick is 33 years old and is a single farmer. He has spent five years in the business. 

He would like to use this loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest further in his farm so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is 65 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Haidee has a fishing business in the Philippines. Haidee requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Haidee has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Haidee would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Pinky works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Pinky is borrowing PHP 4,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Pinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh, 56 years old, is married and has three sons and one daughter. She and her husband support the family through the income they earn by sewing clothes. They began this business 20 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhanh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital to buy a new sewing machine. The additional capital will enable her to increase her production and sales. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and that this will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to increase her production of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en: Enkhchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Using her previous loan, she launched her household appliance sales business two years ago. Before running her own business, she had worked as an accountant for 10 years. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy goods from China at wholesale prices. During this time of year, demand for household appliances increases due to the new year holiday so she wants to continue to sell goods without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy household appliances in large amounts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de frutales, cafeto y arroz, comercio de los mismo y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como obrero en construcción civil, realizando las actividades de encofrados, columnas, pisos, los trabajos los realiza en el distrito de Pucara y caseríos aledaños, cuenta con más de 4 años dedicándose a este rubro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas y de esta manera tener poder realizar de una mejor manera su trabajo, así como atendiendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Adriano is 56 years old and lives with his wife in the district of Pucará, a community characterized by its warm climate. The local people work mostly in agriculture, principally cultivating and selling fruits, coffee and rice, and also raising livestock. This community is located two hours from the city of Jáen, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the mountains of northern Peru. Adriano has a construction business. He builds frames for houses and installs floors. He does his work in Pucará and in neighboring areas. He has more than four years of experience in this trade. He is seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles in order to purchase tools so that he can perform his work more effectively and thus be able to meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: to purchase tools for construction work.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 47 años de edad habita con su esposo que es motorista y sus dos  hijos en casa propia. Marta es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de  varios años, cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el,  por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para poder  mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her own house. Her husband works as a driver. 

Marta is an enterprising, hardworking woman. Several years ago, she decided to start a small business from her home. She runs a small store which she has managed to maintain over the years with great effort and dedication. She has a large clientele, since her customers are her most important priority. She always attends to them with a smile and a friendly attitude, so she has earned the trust of many people in her area. She also always has what her clients are looking for.

She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life, and she knows that she cannot neglect her small business since it is her only source of income. She works hard every day to keep her business running. Therefore, she came to INTEGRAL to apply for a loan to invest in her store. She will stock her store with all types of products, such as rice, beans, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, and detergent, as well as other products which her clients will find attractive. She believes that in this way, she will make her dream come true and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper and detergent.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora luz marina vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como cajera en una institución de estado.casada con dos pequeño hijos en edad escolar.

Doña luz está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en gastos médicos y compra de medicamento  ya que  esto lo necesita con urgencia para su abuelita que está muy mal de salud.  manifiesta que también va hacer  pagos a la funeraria.

Agrace  mucho el apoyo  que kiva y ceprodel le dan al otorgarle el crédito. Ya que en estos momento son difícil para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina lives in the city of Managua. She is a teller in a state institution. She is married and has two children in elementary school.

Luz is requesting a loan to invest it in medical expenses and to purchase medicine as she needs it urgently for her grandfather who is in very bad health. And, with much regret we believe as well to pay for funeral costs.

She sends her thanks to Kiva and Ceprodel for giving her this loan, as both she and her family are currently going through a difficult time.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Julia es comerciante vende refrescos en las calles aledañas del mayoreo el bisne, su negocio lo empezo con ahorro , es una señora sola, a salido adelante ,vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana a doce del día,   su financiamiento lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio para mantener materia prima ya que con dinero ella compra al por mayor y aprovecha descuentos.
texts.en: Julia sells beverages in the local streets of El Bisne. She started her business with her savings. She is single and gets by selling from Monday to Sunday from 8 a.m. until noon. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies for her business since, with funding, she can buy at wholesale and take advantage of discounts.

loans.use: to buy buckets, sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es: El señor Regino Francisco se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios en su triciclo desde hace 7 años, es padre de dos niños que estan estudiando, se esfuerza dia a dia para llevar el sustento a su hogar, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien tambien tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, el señor Regino labora de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, solicita financiamiento para realizarle mejoras a su triciclo y brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes
texts.en:
Regino Francisco has been providing services on his pedicab for 7 years. He is father to two children who are studying. He strives daily to provide for his family. He counts on the support of his wife, who also has a small business in her house. Regino works Monday to Sunday from 7am until 5pm. 

He is requesting this loan to improve his pedicab and to provide better conditions to his clients.

loans.use: to improve his pedicab.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn helps her husband earn a living by managing their coconut farm while he works as a driver. For five years she has been running this farm and has made a good living. She has been able to provide for the needs of the family, especially those of her only child.

Arlyn borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer to boost her farm. She hopes to gain more profits during this season and use it for their needs. She wants to live better in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is in the agricultural business. To earn a living, she operates a specialized coconut farm and she has had this business for 11 years. She earns well from her farm and she was able to successfully repay her previous loans. 

Recently, Gina borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of weeding, maintenance, and fertilization. She was able to help her neighbor because she paid them for cleaning her coconut farm. Gina is striving to make her business successful for the future of her family and she plans to buy a one-hectare coconut farm with the profit.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding, maintenance, and fertilization.

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Peru native Jeffrey was 4 years old when he moved with his family to the United States. When he was 16, Jeffrey helped his father dispatch trucks, so naturally, when he decided to retire from the United States Marine Corps (USMC) several years later, he wanted to enter into the transportation industry. It was then that he formally bought transport company CTE Transport.

“This is my first accomplishment as an adult. I want to see it grow,” the 24-year-old entrepreneur says of CTE Transport.

Though Jeffrey had trouble initially getting his business up and running, the “Never Give Up” lesson he learned so well from the Marine Corps fueled his determination and allowed him to see it through. 

Jeffrey would one day like to have a fleet of trucks, but right now he only has one truck. Your loan contribution will go towards helping Jeffrey purchase a used truck and trucking equipment that will increase the number of miles his truck can cover.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has worked in the construction business for over a decade. He started Verde Building Solutions when he realized that there were not many minority real estate and construction professionals in his area with his level of experience.

Verde Building Solutions is a developing leader in commercial construction, energy infrastructure improvements, facilities management, and facilities maintenance. The business also provides turnkey resources for all aspects of default property management. Ronald’s mission is to consistently meet and exceed his clients’ expectations. He and his management team are committed to quality and excellence as they offer cost effective solutions and sustainable strategies to their clients.

With this loan, Ronald, a father and entrepreneur, will invest in enhancing his marketing efforts and consequently enhance his company’s visibility in the market. He will also use the loan to buy new equipment and a computer.

Check out Ronald’s business here: www.verdebs.com

loans.use: to buy a computer and enhance his marketing efforts.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn owns and operates farmland. She plants and harvests bananas to sell to earn a living. For six years in her farming business, Jocelyn has earned enough to cultivate the vacant areas of her farm and also successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used to improve the farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional fertilizer and pay replanting costs for bananas. She strives to improve the farm and secure a stable source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and pay for replanting costs of bananas.

loans.name: María Tania

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Damas Responsables, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente aún mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora. María tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 niños de 12 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio, vive en la casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de su hogar.
Doña María desde hace 10 años labora como secretaria en un radio taxi  en turnos rotativos y de domingo a domingo, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en alimento para los mismos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is now taking out her third loan with her friends as a member of the "Damas Responsables" (Responsible Ladies) credit group. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca. This city is considered the third most important in the country and has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999. 

Maria is a 32-year-old single mother of two children who are twelve and two years old. Her first daughter is in secondary school. They live at her parents house and she shares the household expenses with them. Maria has worked as a secretary for a radio taxi company for ten years. She works rotating shifts every week and also raises pigs. She will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs and animal feed. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 27 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase farm needs and pay for the laborers' salaries for her farm.

Analiza has been farming rice for eight years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm needs and pay the laborers' salaries for her farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and married. She has eight children, four of whom are in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business, buying and selling charcoal, in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for two years.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a manicure business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Rosario is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new tools for her manicure business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her manicure business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Estelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan  through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Estelita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Estelita would like to save money money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Enrequita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Enrequita is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Enrequita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid twenty-seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Elsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 34 years old and married with two children, both in school. Glory works very hard to provide for them.

Glory runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Glory has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Glory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh is 40 years old and is married with two sons. Her husband is a salesman. Linh has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Linh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items, sugar, milk, candies, and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items, sugar, milk, candies,  and many kinds of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Carrol

texts.en:
Carrol works hard to support her family. Carrol is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Carrol requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Carrol has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Carrol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh, 57, is single and lives with her mother in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money through selling soft drinks and cellphone cards in front of her door. She started this business ten years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy soft drinks, cellphone cards, and new furniture for her shop. She hopes her business will ensure that her family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cellphone cards. and new furniture for her shop.

loans.name: Flor Catalina

texts.es:
Flor es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es casada su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería, ellos solo tienen 1 hijo de 5 años de edad y que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la preparatorio, en su vivienda solo viven y dependen de  ella su  esposo y su hijo. 

Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de pan horneado, desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a la fabricación de pan y a la venta, pues es un trabajo hereditario, por parte de su mamá que desde que estaba pequeña su madre le enseño a aprender este oficio. Ella dice que es un medio de obtener ingresos, para su familia y también tiene otros tipo de ingreso que es la venta por catálogo que tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposo en los trabajos que desarrolla. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para ampliar su producción de pan y compra de materia prima para su fabricación, harina azúcar etc. esto le permitirá producir más y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. Gracias al crédito  le permitirá ampliar su producción y tener más variedad de pan para sus clientes.

Flor siempre ha querido seguir estudiando, terminar una carrera universitaria y también ampliar más su negocio; 
vivir en un casa digna  para su familia y para su niño desea que sea una persona de bien que estudie mucho, todo esto lo lograra gracias al crédito solicitado que comenta que le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio y  futuros créditos que sacara para mejorar su negocio y poder emplear a más personas en su panadería.
texts.en:
Flor is 25 years old and completed high school.  She is married and her husband makes a living as a builder.  The couple has one five-year-old son.  He is currently in nursery school.  The three of them live together.

Flor makes a living baking and selling bread.  She has been doing this since she was very young, having learned the trade from her mother from an early age.  Flor tells us that this is a source of income for her family.  For the last six years she has also been earning money selling out of catalogues.  Flor's husband always supports her in her work.

Flor is applying for a loan in order to increase her bread production, and to buy basic supplies (such as flour, sugar, etc) for said work.  This will help Flor to produce more and earn a higher income for her family.  Thanks to this loan, Flor can increase production and offer her customers a greater choice of breads.

Flor has always wanted to study again, and finish a university degree.  She would also like to expand her business, and have a decent house for her family.  Flor wants her son to be a good person, who studies a lot.  Flor will achieve all these things with this loan which, she tells us, has helped her business greatly.  Future loans will also help her to improve her business and allow her to employ more people in her bread shop.

loans.use: to increase her bread production, and to buy basic supplies (such as flour, sugar, etc) for said work.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía de 66 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas mayores de edad y residen en los estados unidos.  Ella estudio solo tercer grado, pero le da las gracias a Dios primero y a los padres de ella, por darle ese tiempo de estudio porque, en ese tiempo comenta que algunos padres decían que de letras no se vivía, que habia que trabajar.  
Está casada, el esposo trabaja la agricultura tiene mucha experiencia en ese rubro, también en la ganadería tiene un poco de experiencia también.   

Con el crédito comprara un toro para las vaquitas que tiene, porque ellos ya están un poco señores, para andar con las vacas buscando toro cuando estén en celo. Por eso para ella, es una necesidad tenerlo juntos con la vacas. 
   
A futuro le gustaría seguir trabajando, mientras el creador la lleva y quiere tener segura la leche y la cuajada, es una manera de sobrevivir en los cantones alejados de los pueblos.
texts.en:
Sofia, 66 years old, is a mother of 2 grown up daughters who now live in the U.S. Her highest level of education achieved was the 3rd grade. She recalls that back then, some parents used to say “Man does not live by letters alone”, and that work was a priority over school. For this reason, she is thankful to God and to her parents, for granting her that opportunity to study up to the 3rd grade.

Sofia is married, and her husband works in agriculture. He is very experienced in this field, and he also has some experience in livestock.
With this loan, she will buy a bull, for the few cows that they own. Given that they are a senior couple now, moving around with the cows when they are in heat is no longer an easy task. This is why they need to buy a bull, to keep it near their cows.

She would like to continue to work in the future, as long as it is possible, to produce milk and ‘cuajada’ (milk curd/cheese product), and continue to subsist well in the rural areas away from the towns.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que por problemas económicos de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando, ella esta acompañada , su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y presta servicio como vendedor en una comercial. También, con ellos conviven dos sobrinos los cuales están estudiando 6º y 8º grado y elle los cuida, porque la mamá delos niños, trabaja la cual le ayuda a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Idalia solo tiene dos hijos mayores de edad.

Idalia, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y en los ratos libre le ayuda a su espeso en la agricultura, puesto que el nació cerca de una hacienda donde se cultivaba mucho maíz y desde la edad de 10 años, inicio con la aventura en los campos agrícolas, junto a su padre,  fue con ellos que aprendió esta actividad. Sin embargo, hay temporadas en que los sobrinos no estudian y ella se dedica a las venta con su esposo, para poder aportar mas a los ingresos económicos del hogar.


Idalia invertirá el crédito, en pagar unos gastos médicos que adquirió de una operación de su esposo y tanbien en la compra de insumos ( abono, insecticidas y fungicidas )para 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz ,el cual espera tener buenas cosechas y mejores ingresos  para ofrecerles una estancia adecuada, para su familia y poder abonarle a su crédito.


Los sueños y metas que quisiera  lograr Idalia son: primero que su esposo se recupere luego y a la vez,   que le vaya bien en el cultivo y por ultimo tener un pequeño negocio . El préstamo sera de mucha ayuda, para Idalia, porque así, podrá beneficiar bien sus cultivos, y los ingresos podrán ser mejores , así mismo lograra, tener  de donde cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Idalia, age 40, went to school up until the sixth grade.  Due to her parents’ financial problems, she was not able to continue her studies.  Her husband is a farmer, and he is a salesperson at a business.  Also, two of her sibling’s children live with them.  They are in the sixth and eighth grades.  She takes care of them because their mother works.  This helps to cover the household expenses.  Idalia only has two children, and they are grown.

Idalia devotes herself to the household chores.  In her free time she helps her husband with the farming.  He was born close to a ranch where they grew a lot of corn.  At the age of ten he started with the adventure in the fields with his father.  It was with them that she learned this business activity.  

Nevertheless, there are times when her sibling’s children do not go to school, and she devotes herself to sales with her husband in order to be able to contribute more to the household income.

Idalia will use the loan to pay medical expenses for an operation that her husband had.  She will also buy supplies (fertilizer, insecticides, and fungicides) for 7,000 square meters of corn.  She hopes to have good harvests and better income in order to provide her family with an adequate dwelling and to be able to pay her loan.

Idalia’s dreams and goals are first, for her husband to recover, and then, for her crops to do well.  Lastly, she would like to have a small business.  The loan will be a big help to Idalia because this way she will be able to take good care of her crops.  Income will be better, and she will manage to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for an operation that her husband had.  She will also buy supplies (fertilizer, insecticides, and fungicides) for 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Alvaro Ivan

texts.en: Alvaro dreams of working in commercial engineering. Alvaro was accepted into the Universidad Privada Del Valle and now with the chance to achieve his dream, he is concerned about affording the schoolbooks he desperately needs. He expects to graduate in June 2015 but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Alvaro shares that it is important for him to graduate on time so he can enter the job market as soon as possible. With the loan, Alvaro plans to purchase his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Alvaro feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With three older siblings, Alvaro is unsure how he will be able to afford his school costs on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Heyder Henry

texts.en: Heyder is currently attending the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo, working towards his degree in public accounting & finance. He expects to graduate in June 2014 but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Heyder shares that it is important for him to graduate on time so he can enter the job market as soon as possible. With the loan, Heyder plans to purchase his textbooks. With them, Heyder hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Heyder currently works 30 hours a week and earns $4 a day. With a career in public accounting and finance, he expects to earn $8 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Heyder's family is already under a financial strain and he is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge dreams of becoming an accountant. Jorge is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards his degree in public accounting & finance. He plans to graduate in January 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Jorge plans to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often in Bolivia, there are fees for earning your title before graduating. Jorge currently works 40 hours a week as a cashier in a store and earns $8 a day. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in public accounting & finance, he expects to earn $15 a day during his first year of work. For his family of four, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling already attending college, Jorge is unsure how he will be able to afford his graduation fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Jorge's father works in construction and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Jorge hopes to be able to contribute to his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Daly

texts.en: Daly has always dreamed of becoming a dentist. Daly is currently attending at the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in dentistry. She plans to graduate in the coming months but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Daly plans to pay her tuition while she saves her salary from her part time job. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Daly currently works 30 hours a week and earns $9 a day. With a degree in dentistry, she expects to earn $15 a day during her first year out of school. Daly's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of four, finances were always tight. With one older sibling, Daly is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs

loans.name: Moises Aaron

texts.es: Moisés es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega, casado y padre de dos hijos. Tiene 25 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de joyería. Inicio trabajando en una joyería hace muchos años; al tener su clientela decide solicitar un financiamiento para independizarse. Poco a poco obtuvo su negocio.  Actualmente tiene un negocio prospero, ubicándolo en las afueras de su casa cerca del mercado.  Solicita el crédito para comprar gramos  de oro, con el fin de ofertar todo tipo de joyería para todo tipo de ocasión. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cubrir con toda la demanda de sus clientes y obtener un crecimiento en su negocio. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para brindar mejor atención y comodidad al público.
texts.en:
Moisés is 25 years old, a native Chinandega, a married father of two children, and owns a jewelry shop. He began working in a jewelry store many years ago, but he started to build customer base and decided to apply for a loan so he could start his own business. Moisés established his business gradually, but now has a thriving shop near his home and close to a market. 

Moisés is applying for a loan to purchase grams of gold so that he can offer his customers a full range of jewelry for every occasion. He believes that the loan will be very beneficial as it will allow him to meet his customers' demand and grow his business. Moisés plans to renovate his store so that he can provide better service and a more comfortable ambience to the public.

loans.use: para comprar gramos  de oro.

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es: Iris, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre a buscado un medio de vida, hace 10 años inicio con la venta de pan casero como torta de leche, semitas, quesadilla y otros y también a la elaboración y venta de tamales de carne de cerdo y pollo. Actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo de préstamo, el cual es por 21,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de materiales como madera, cemento, arena, y otros materiales para construir el área de la cocina y colocar mejor su negocio. Sus planes son ampliar la casa y mejorar los ingresos de su negocio para un mejor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Iris is 27 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the municipality of Choloma, in the department of Cortés. She has always looked for a way to make a living, and 10 years ago she started selling homemade breads, such as “torta de leche” [“milk cake” – similar to bread pudding], “semitas” [a sweet bun with a powdery-sugary glaze], “quesadillas” [a traditional Honduran cake made of cheese] and others, as well as pork and chicken tamales.

Iris is requesting this loan of 21,000 HNL to buy materials such as wood, cement and sand to build a kitchen area for her business. This is her third loan cycle. In the future she hopes to increase her income from her business and the size of her house to improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, cement and sand to build a kitchen area for her business.

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Mrs. Marusya, 58 years old, lives alone in a house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a meat sales business since 2007 by renting a stall at a market. Her daughter and son live separately. 

Marusya's son is currently unemployed and ultimately decided to render taxi service to local people. In order to offer taxi service, he needs a good quality car, but he has no cash for a car. As a mother who wants to help her son, Marusya is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it doesn't emit harmful pollutants while wasting less fuel per kilometer traveled. It is very beneficial for both her son's income generation and environmental safety.

loans.use: to buy electric car

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Kodjovi papa de 03 enfants(13,8 et 05ans) est assistant médical. Il a ouvert son cabinet en 1998 et s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de se prendre en charge. Il revend des produits pharmaceutiques et sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Il espère ouvrir d'autres cabinets avec le profit et mieux nourrir sa famille.
texts.en: Kodjovi is a father of three children (aged 13, 8 and 5), and works as a medical assistant. He opened his practice in 1998, and is pleased with it because it allows him to provide for himself. He works reselling pharmaceutical products, and has requested his third loan to buy merchandise. With his profits, Kodjovi hopes to open other consulting rooms and provide his family with better food.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits d'alimentation générale, madame Ayaba fait sa première demande à WAGES pour renforcer son activité. Elle s'approvisionne au Grand Marché et revend dans une boutique. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de réinvestir dans l'activité et de mieux s'épanouir. Elle est âgée de 37ans avec une ancienneté d'01an.
texts.en: Ayaba has requested her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to buy general food products and strengthen her business. She gets her supplies in the Grand Market, and resells them in a store. The profits she makes from her sales will allow Ayaba to reinvest in her business and get ahead in life. She is 37 years of age, and has been in this business for one year.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been earning income from her transport service business for more than two years. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to obtain accessories and tires, and she successfully repaid it.

In addition to her transport business, Lorna has also been engaged in a retailing business, selling assorted groceries in her community. Lorna has borrowed a new loan, to buy additional grocery goods to resell in order to gain more for her only child, and the family as well. She is hopeful about the possibility of improving her business, for the better living of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 30-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Alaa would like to start his own business by opening a small project for making ice cream and sell it in his store; it is the only one in his area. Alaa dreams of implementing his idea and maybe opening a bigger store in the future. 

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to start his project by buying a machine for making ice cream. 

Alaa  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to start up his income-generating project by buying a machine for making ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a variety of goods for her store, including soda and used clothing.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is 55, married, and has three children. He has grown and harvested a rice crop for twenty-five years. He carefully manages this business because it is his family's source of income. Gained income from his business was used to cover their household consumption and allowances. With his determination to keep improving his rice farming business, Eduardo decided to borrow additional capital amounting to 10,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides, and rice seeds. He knows that this loan amount would help him greatly in obtaining his goal in life. He just hopes that his loan requests will be approved.

loans.use: to buy items such as fertilizers, insecticides, and rice seeds to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 23ans, Yao marié à une coiffeuse a 01 enfant en charge. Il est tuilier de profession depuis 2009. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour acheter un moule pour fabriquer des tuiles. Il souhaite renforcer l'activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Yao is a young, 23-year-old man, who is married to a hairdresser and has one child. Since 2009 he has worked as a tiler. In order to improve his business, he has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a mold to make tiles. Yao wants to strengthen his business and ensure that his family gets ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy molds to make tiles

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en: Mansueta is a 58-year-old married woman. With the help of her two grown children, she continues to look after the sari-sari (variety) store that provides her income. Mansueta is requesting a loan to buy products to sell such as rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack food. She will buy products that her customers use on a daily basis. Mansueta is hopeful that her business will become more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack food.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 27-year-old woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail store, where she sells animal feeds. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of animal feeds. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to payback the loan.

loans.use: buy stock of animal feeds.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 33 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Elna has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Elna requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Elna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Josephine is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Josephine has been raising pigs for five years, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenny Marcela

texts.es: Es una joven con muchas metas por cumplir, una de ellas era ingresar a los estudios superiores, pero la falta de recursos le impedía hacer realidad los sueños, una persona cercana a ella le quería colaborar para lograr el objetivo y a futuro tener una mejor condición de vida, solo que aquella persona no tenia un ingreso económico alto, sin embargo preguntaron opciones de financiación en la institución y allí le dieron la informacion de kiva  gracias a este subsidio aquella joven empezó a luchar por hacer el sueño realidad, hoy en día y con ayuda del subsidio pasara a segundo semestre y a si poco a poco y con gran esfuerzo lograra cumplir las metas.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young woman with many goals. One of them was to begin post-secondary education, but her lack of finances prevented her from making this dream come true. However, someone who is close to her wanted to collaborate to help her achieve her goal and have a better life in the future. This person did not have a very high income, but they asked about financing options at the educational institution, and there, they received information about Kiva.

Thanks to this loan, this young woman was able to start making her dream a reality. Today, thanks to this loan, she will be going into her second semester. Little by little and with a lot of effort, she will reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en: Tumurbaatar, 49 years old, lives with his family in a house on a plot of land in Erdenet, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a machinist at a copper mine since 1990. His wife is saleswoman at a store. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years, especially the floor. Tumurbaatar is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT to install a low pressure heater and hardwood floor in his house. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to install a low pressure heater and hardwood floor.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 36-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a repair store, where he repairs torn shoes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is unfavourable weather conditions. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy thread, leather, and other materials for repairing shoes. His business goal is to be stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: to buy thread, leather, and other materials for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been selling shoes to local people at a bazaar since 2010. Her husband breeds domesticated birds and sells them to farms. 

The roof on their house was damaged by heavy rain during the summer and the overall quality of their house has declined due to many years of use.
