When Dina was very young, her mother would take her on her sales rounds, and that was how Dina grew to like the business that she continues on today. She buys in the capital, and sometimes from another city. She has to travel from her canton by bus to the capital, about 2 hours to reach the place she buys from. She then returns to her canton to sell her products. She does this in a neighboring village, where she starts her day at 5am to make breakfast for her children and husband. She then prepares her sales and goes out at 8 in the morning, returning at 2 in the afternoon to take care of her family.

This loan will be used for her clothing business to purchase, specifically, 3 dozen bras, 2 dozen undies, 2 dozen thongs, a dozen skirts, a dozen pairs of socks, and a dozen backpacks. The loan will let her purchase these things at the cheaper wholesale price so that she earns more from her sales.

Her dream is to buy some land and leave a piece of it to each of her children. Another dream of hers is that her children will be ready for a career at university, since that was an opportunity she never had. With her earnings, she expects to pay off this loan and save to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale at wholesale prices.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, solo estudió cuarto grado debido a que su papá las abandonó y quedó solo con su mamá y ella para sostener el hogar la mandaba a vender y por eso dejó la escuela, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella y ninguno estudia.

María se dedica al comercio de mariscos desde que tiene 8 años, pues fue su mamá quien la mandaba a vender y así aprendió el negocio, ella siempre se ha dedicado solo a este negocio. Para comprar los productos, ella camina desde el caserío donde vive unos 15 minutos a pie para tomar el bus que la lleva hasta su destino, el bus recorre una hora y media; luego compra la mercadería, la prepara y de una sola vez se va hasta la ciudad que es donde vende en el mercado, en ocasiones lo hace también de casa en casa en los caseríos aledaños donde ella vive. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 AM para prepararse y conducirse al trabajo, sale de su casa a las 6:30 AM y regresa a casa a las 5:30 PM, esa es su rutina diaria.  


El préstamo será invertido, para comprar 50 libras de pescado, 50 libras de camarón, 25 libras de chacalines, jaibas y mas. El préstamo mejorará en que comprará más productos y más baratos y también que se evitará viajar todos los días para ir a comprar, por lo tanto le quedará mas ganancia.

Sus sueños, construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que la que hoy tiene es de adobe y ya no sirve, comprar un terreno y dejarles un puesto a cada uno de sus hijos, con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas de la institución, además ahorrar para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She only stayed in school through the fourth grade, when her father left her and her mother. To keep the family afloat, her mother sent her out to sell and she had to leave school. She is a single mother and has three children, none of whom are in school.

María has been in the business of selling seafood for eight years now. Ever since her mother sent her out to sell and she learned how, she's been a saleswoman all her life. To buy her products, she walks from her home village some 15 minutes to catch a bus that will take her where she needs to go. The bus takes an hour and a half. She buys her merchandise, prepares it, then goes to the city where she sells her goods. She sometimes also sells from door to door in the villages near where she lives. She wakes up at 5:00am to get ready for work, leaves her house at 6:30am, and returns home again at 5:30pm. This is her daily schedule.

This loan will be invested in her business through the purchase of 50 lbs of fish, 50 lbs of shrimp, and 25 lbs of crawfish, crabs, and more. This loan will help her by enabling her to purchase more products more cheaply, and will also mean she doesn't have to travel every single day to buy goods, which will leave her more of her income.

Her dreams include building a house of brick, since the adobe one she has now doesn't work, and buying some land and leaving some of it to each of her children. With her earnings, she hopes to pay off the loan and leave the doors of the institution open to her, and also to save toward her dreams.

loans.use: buy large quantities of fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 31-year-old single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a green grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a suitable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some of the products are perishable. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business that serves everybody. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Diana Iris

texts.es:
Diana Iris tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos a en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Diana realiza esta labor para apoyar su esposo con los gastos familiares y ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Iris, 41, lives with her husband and two children in the district of Oyotun. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The town is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.

Diana Iris raises and sells farm animals from the back part of her house. She does this work to support her husband with the household expenses. She has applied for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles to buy balanced feed so that she will have higher production to offer her clients, generating a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán tiene 52 años de edad, vive en Malacasi, una zona rural de Salitral, su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, que los ofrece en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar ovejas para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Hernán is 52 years old. He lives in Malacasi, a rural area of Salitral. Its people work in commerce and in agriculture. It is part of Morropón, located two hours from the city of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

He raises and sells goats, which he offers in the area market. He has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN to buy sheep to fatten and later offer [for sale] at a better price.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Wiliter

texts.en:
Wiliter is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children, ages ranging from four years to 16 years. She describes herself to be hopeful and trustful. She operates a farm where she grows tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her farm is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuations of tea prices.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Fatima is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Fatima has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Zion Christian Association Group

texts.en:
Winfred is a 35-year-old lady; she is married with five children of which three are school goers. She is an old client of our institution. 

She runs a retail shoe shop in Entebbe Kitoro town, which she started five years ago. She has been able to get income to cater to the needs of her family.

She has borrowed a loan of ugx.900,000 to add more stock of shoes to her shop. 

She mainly sells school shoes for children and she is targeting the season. 

She is so grateful to the institution because she has been able to boust her business by borrowing from our institution. She hopes to open up another shop to increase her income and savings with us.

She is a God-fearing lady, honest and loves her customers - that’s why her business has been able to last for long.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a medicine vending business in the Philippines. 
She has been in this business for nine years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of medicine to sell. In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Rosalie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of personal products to sell. NWTF is re-listing Shirley's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber yard business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years and also earns more income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell at her lumber yard business. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Dinah works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Dinah is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, fish, etc

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang, 32, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband. Sang earns money through hairdressing services while her husband earns a living as a soldier. Sang would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of hairdressing material and tools to better satisfy her customers. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of hairdressing material and tools to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending. Edna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: John Leonard

texts.en:
John Leonard is 19 years old and is the first of two children in the family. His mother Ana Marie supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

John Leonard is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the third year of this three-year course.

He  is borrowing PHP 16,500 to pay tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When he graduates, John Leonard plans to be gainfully employed so he can help improve the quality of life of his family

loans.use: to to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Karen Alejandra

texts.en:
Karen wants to work in the petroleum industry. She was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and is studying mining engineering. 

Now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording all the costs of her education. With a loan, Karen plans to buy her schoolbooks. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

She expects to graduate in October 2014, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Karen shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a career in mining engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day. With two older siblings attending college already, Karen is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for schoolbooks.

loans.name: Nieves Sonia

texts.en:
Nieves wants to become a carpenter. To achieve her goal, Nieves has enrolled in Escuela Taller La Paz. She plans on graduating in April 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With this loan, Nieves plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Nieves hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Nieves currently works 30 hours a week and earns $6 a day. With a degree in carpentry, she expects to earn $10 a day. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Nieves hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Samina is so very thankful to Kiva.

Note: In the picture Samina raises her hand.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material, threads and elastic.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: El señor Wilmer tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y aún vive con su mamá tuvo que empezar a trabajar desde temprana edad, pues su padre los abandono cuando él era muy pequeño  y su madre está muy enferma. Se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, tiene varias cabezas de ganado lechero que producen 152 litros de leche al día. Es una persona responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse y seguir ayudando a su mamá. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar cascara de soya para el ganado lechero pues en esta época del año escasea mucho y no quiere bajar su producción actual pues eso significaría menos ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 23 years old. He is single and still lives with his mother. He needed to start working at an early age since his father abandoned them when he was very young and his mother is ill. 

He works in the production of raw milk. He has several head of dairy cattle that produce 152 liters of milk each day. He is a responsible person and is eager to succeed and continue helping his mother. 

Currently he is asking for a loan in order to buy soybean hulls for the dairy cattle because in this season of the year it is in short supply and he does not want to reduce production as that would mean less income for his family.

loans.use: to buy soybean hulls as feed for his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Martin Bosco

texts.es:
Don Martin pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casado, con  45 años de edad,  Profesional, comerciante trabaja una pequeña pulpería desde hace 8 años. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposa y sus dos hijos, uno mayor de edad. Toda la familia depende de los ingresos de su pequeño negocio.

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema de mejoramiento y ampliación de cerramiento, consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema de tratamiento, esto lo requiere  ya que por donde el habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familiar cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Martin tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. Con su bajo ingreso es imposible que logre instalar, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Martin, 45, lives in the town of Niquinohomo, which was chosen for the alliance creation program to strengthen local sanitation measures in Nicaragua. He is married and has worked as a vendor in a small store for eight years. His immediate family is comprised of his wife and two children, one who is an adult. The entire family depends on the income from his small business.

He is currently applying for the water and sanitation project through a loan to install a larger, better enclosure. This involves installing a conventional toilet with the construction of a treatment system. He needs this because where he lives, he doesn't have access to the sewage system. For this reason, his family uses a latrine; they are one of the thousands of families who don't have access to better sanitation. This project is benefiting various municipalities in the country and will allow for a better quality of life and it will also contribute to the environment.

Without the opportunity for this loan, it would be impossible for Martin to gain access to a toilet, which is very expensive. With his low income, it would be impossible to install. These programs help families living in extremely poor conditions. Latrines cause sickness and they contaminate the environment. This has led to the idea of finding solutions directed at the poorest areas.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a larger, improved enclosure with blocks, cement, ground rocks, tubing, and ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío La Toma, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, también se dedica a la venta de camote, yuca y tubérculos, es una madre emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maximina is 43 years old and lives with her husband in the La Toma neighborhood, a rural area in the Buenos Aires district.  This community is known as an agricultural area with some commerce and livestock, located in the Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals and also sells sweet potatoes, yucca, and tubers.  She is an enterprising mother who is asking for a loan of 1,600 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed for her animals and also pigs to fatten up and sell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Nadia Lizeth

texts.es:
Nadia Lizeth tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito Cayaltí, una comunidad que se encuentra sobre el valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público y movilidad escolar en su propia mototaxi, también tiene un pequeño negocio que ofrece venta de aceites y lubricanes , ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de aceites y lubricantes para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nadia Lizeth is 23 years old and lives with her husband in the Cayaltí district, a community located within the Zaña valley.  Its population are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock and is located in the Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She provides public transportation services with her moto-taxi, and also has a small business where she sells oils and lubricants.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Nuevos Soles to buy oil in quantity, and lubricants to offer to her customers.  This way she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil and lubricants.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Caserío de Nueva Esperanza del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, gallinas, patos y pavos desde hace un año, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 24 years old and lives with his son in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of the Oyotún district, a community known for its hospitality.  Its population farms, are merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He has been raising and selling corral animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys for a year.  He is an enterprising father who is asking for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed so he can fatten up his animals and have an increased production to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a green grocery where he sells vegetables and fruits. His business is located in a market place which is a conducive environment, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits. His business goal is to be a supplier of fruits and vegetables within 5 years. Samuel hopes that in the future he will improve his family's living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. María se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en el grupo de crédito Damas Responsables al cual fue invitada por su cuñada, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente aún mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 17 años que pasa en casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar, su esposo labora como tapicero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña María se dedica a pintar artesanías especialmente de cerámica, las mismas que vende a sus amigas y conocidas, lleva dos años en el negocio. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerámica para continuar agrandando su negocio. Su meta es tener un local propio en donde vender sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Sra. María is taking out her first loan from the Damas Responsables Communal Bank, which she was invited to join by her sister-in-law. She lives in the vicinity of the city of Cuenca. This city is considered the third most important in the country.  It was named a World Heritage site in December, 1999. Its people still maintain their traditional culture.

Sra. María is 36 years old, married  and has a 17 year old daughter who lives at home and helps her with household duties. Her husband works as an upholsterer. She does not own her home but lives in a relative’s house.

Doña María works painting folk art, especially in ceramics. She also sells these objects to her friends and acquaintances.  She has had this business for two years. She will invest her loan in the purchase of ceramics in order to continue expanding her business. Her goal is to have her own shop where she can sell her handicrafts,

loans.use: to purchase ceramics.

loans.name: Angie

texts.es:
Angie Catalina  actualmente tiene 17 años y  vive en Bogotá con los dos hermanos  y los padres.
Desde pequeña había sido una niña muy inquieta y le gustaba mucho salir con los amigos a jugar fútbol,escondidas entre otros juegos, Vivía  como todo niño a esa edad, buscando cómo y en qué ocupar el tiempo. Las pasiones de ella siempre han sido los animales,la velocidad y conocer lugares;  razón por la cual quería ser azafata o zoóloga. 
Transcurrido el tiempo comenzó a estudiar en un colegio cercano a la casa; allí aprendió muchas cosas, y como era una niña muy aplicada el rector decidió promoverla de cuarto a sexto grado que se le complico un poco por que empezó a ver temas mucho más complejos y a quedarle menos tiempo para compartir con los amigos. 
Teniendo 11 años, el  vecino le comenta sobre los cursos y  las actividades que se encontraba realizando el organismo de socorro al  que él pertenecía, la “DEFENSA CIVIL” decidió  ingresar, descubriendo muchas cosas que para ella habían sido indiferentes, motivada por todo eso, continuo asistiendo cada domingo durante cuatro años. Cumplidos los 15 años, los temas que había visto por tanto tiempo empezaron a cambiar y  aprendió otras cosas, conoció gente que le enseñaba conocimientos básicos en primeros auxilios; al principio esos temas los tomaba como algo que solo aprendería mas no le llamaban la atención, pero al transcurrir los años y al ver  a algunos de los instructores que eran enfermeros, se entusiasmó a ser como ellos, a salvar vidas y a sentir esa misma dedicación que ellos demostraban.
Sus ganas de seguir aprendiendo y conociendo la hicieron disminuir la ansiedad y el deseo de ser a futuro lo que cuando niña había deseado; zoóloga y azafata, se habían cambiado por el deseo de ser enfermera y de ayudar a la gente. Se le hacía sorprendente que lo que aprendió en la defensa civil se hubiera convertido en la base para escoger lo que le  apasionaba ser ahora.
A los 16 años ya había cumplido parte de sus metas; se había graduado ya de bachillerato y debía comenzar a buscar donde estudiaría enfermería. Busco en varios institutos e ingreso a Campo Alto, sitio en donde sigue estudiando actualmente, ahora se encuentra comenzando tercer semestre y le serviría la ayuda de kiva  para que pueda continuar en su técnico  y  en la Defensa Civil.
Finalmente ella decide que al terminar quiere continuar con la especialización en pediatría y  profundizar cada día más en su profesión.
texts.en:
Angie Catalina is 17 years old and lives in Bogotá with her two brothers and her parents.
Ever since she was little, she's been an energetic girl and she's always liked going out with her friends to play football and other games. Like any child her age, she sought ways to spend her free time. Her passions have always been animals, going fast, and getting to know places, which is why she wanted to be either a flight attendant or a zoologist when she grew up.

She started attending a school near her home. As she was a dedicated little girl, her principal decided to promote her from fourth to sixth grade. This complicated her life a bit as she encountered new and more difficult ideas which left her less time to spend with her friends.  When she was 11, a neighbor talked to her about the things he was doing as a member of an aid group that he belonged to, the Civil Defense. She decided to enroll, and discovered many things that she had been unaware of before. With this motivation, she continued to attend every Sunday for four years. By the age of 15, the things she was learning had started to change. She met people who taught first aid. At first, she just learned these things, but didn't pay much attention. But over time and after meeting some of her instructors who were nurses, she became enthusiastic about becoming one of them, about saving lives, and she began to feel the same dedication that they showed.

Her desire to keep learning decreased her anxiety and her childhood wishes to become a flight attendant or zoologist, replaced by her wish to be a nurse and help people. She was surprised that what she learned in the Civil Defense had become the basis for choosing her current passion.

At 16, she had achieved part of her goal by graduating from high school and she started looking for a place to study nursing. She looked at various places and enrolled at Campo Alto, where she is currently studying. She is now in her third semester and is seeking support from Kiva so she can continue in her trade and in the Civil Defense.

She has decided that she would like to specialize in pediatrics and is gaining depth in her chosen profession every day.

loans.use: pay for a semester of higher education

loans.name: María Juana Dolores

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta 4to grado de educación básica, está casada; su esposo se dedica al trabajo agropecuario, pues poseen animales y a la vez siembran para alimentarlos. Tienen 3 hijas, pero solo las dos menores viven  y dependen de ellos, una va a 2do año de secundaria y la otra a 6to grado de primaria.

Ellos se dedican principalmente a la venta de queso fresco, elaborado con leche obtenida de 7 vacas que su esposo ordeña desde tempranas horas del día. Para transportarse al terreno donde cultivan maíz, maicillo y donde tienen los animales, deben hacerlo a caballo, pues el camino es bastante rustico, el viaje dura 30 minutos. Sus hijas se involucran en los quehaceres domésticos y también en la elaboración del queso. Ella pasa ocupada todo el día entre el trabajo de campo y el de la casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando es, para pagar mano de obra y el alquiler del equipo para realizar el desgrane  de maíz y poder almacenarlo y a la vez realizar la picada del zacate restante que servirá para alimentar a sus animales.

Ella sueña con tener más animales, adquirir más tierra para cultivarla y de esta manera poder establecerse económicamente. Esto  hará que pueda darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, que son la esperanza de ella para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and has a fourth grade education.  She is married and her husband raises livestock.  They have animals and also raise crops.  They have three daughters but only two are minors and live with them; one is in her second year of middle school and the other one is in sixth grade.

They mainly sell fresh cheese, made from the milk of the seven cows that her husband milks in the early morning.  They have to ride a horse to get to the area where they raise corn and sorghum and keep their animals because the path is very rustic and it takes them 30 minutes.  Her daughters help with the household chores and also make cheese.  She is busy all day between her work in the fields and the home.

She is asking for this loan to pay for labor and rent the equipment she needs to thrash the corn so she can store it and also remove the remaining grass to use as animal feed.

She dreams of having more animals and acquiring more farmland so she can establish herself financially.  This will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her hope for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to have a well established restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will promote youth employment. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 67 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de arroz, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos con la compra de abonos, que le permitirá mejorar su cultivo y así tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 67 years old and lives in the Cañaris district, a community located near the Jequetepeque river valley, which has allowed it to develop through agriculture. Its population is also made up of merchants, they raise livestock, and is located in the Ferreñafe province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She primarily farms and raises rice and is a very enterprising woman.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles to maintain her crops and buy compost that will allow her to better her crops and have a good harvest to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a hog-raiser in the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia. She is 36 years old, and happily married to Crispulo. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two high school aged children. 

As of now, Winnie wants to have more piglets to raise, but she suffers from a financial shortage. 

In this connection, Winnie is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional piglets, as well as the hog feed for daily maintenance to keep her raised hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. 

She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, as well as the feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Lodela

texts.en:
Lodela is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years and also earns additional income from food vending. Lodela aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children; two are babies and are fully dependent upon their mother. 

Her unfinished house is under construction because she does not have savings to complete the remaining construction. Her son owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers and sell it to the retailers. He wants to grow his business and wants to buy more fabrics to offer his customers. 

Therefore, Kousar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy more fabrics to meet the demand.
She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already taken a loan from BRAC and invested it in the business. She hopes that the savings will greatly increase and she will be able to complete the remaining construction of her house. 

Kousar dreams for the bright future of her children, their establishment of business and for a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her son buy fabrics to sell at his clothing shop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years. Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 52 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Florida works very hard to provide for them.

Florida runs a pre-paid mobile load in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional mobile load to resell.

Florida has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Florida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile load to resell.

loans.name: Jurita

texts.en:
Jurita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell chicken business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of chicken to resell in her buy-and-sell chicken business.

Jurita has been in this business for two years. Jurita earns more income from food vending.

Jurita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of chicken to resell.

loans.name: Rocille

texts.en:
Rocille is 18 years old and studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. She is currently on the 2nd of four courses.

Rocille needs 8,500 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the 2nd Semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Rocille plans to be gainfully employed so she can help improve the quality of life for her family

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Drucilla

texts.en:
Dru is a 42 year old Navajo woman who loves to bead. A tragic car accident in 2007 left Dru hospitalized and in an extended care centers for four months. During that time she lost her job, her home and the ability to bead with her right hand. In order to earn an income, she resiliently taught herself to bead with her left hand.   

This $1000 will help her to purchase high quality seed beads, copper bands, and leather lining to produce bracelets that she sells to Etkie, an organization that provides talented women living in poverty with access to an international market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for handcrafted bracelets

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina (22 years old) and her husband Juan (23 years old) have 3 kids: Catalina is the oldest (5 years old), her brother Gaspar (3 years old) and her little brother Fabian who is 8 months old.  They currently live in the San Juan Cancun municipality of the state of Chiapas in Southern Mexico in a one room wood house. 

In their small indigenous community with 282 inhabitants, 242 speak an indigenous language and just 58 speak good Spanish. According to government statistics, just 102 people in the community have work and children school classes are held on a not established schedule. 

Delphina’s parents left them a small plot of land where they sow beans and maize. Sometimes this is not enough to eat, and that´s why they have to find jobs outside the community. This is a challenge since when they leave to find work, they do not have a place to sleep and must make the most of what they can. While the men works outside, the woman and the children collect some herbs and wild fruits to eat.

They know that with the support from Habitat for Humanity Mexico and a loan for their housing, they will be able to build a house where to live with a better life quality. They say that the fact of knowing that they will be able to rest after their work day and have a clean place for their children is something they are looking forward to.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Marcela Valeria

texts.en:
Marcela dreams of becoming a psychologist, but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Marcela has enrolled in the Universidad Domingo Savio. 

She expects to graduate in November 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Marcela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Marcela plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in psychology before graduating. 

With one younger brother, Marcela hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university. Marcela currently works as an administrator in a small office to help afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Gabriela Paola

texts.en:
Gabriela dreams of becoming an accountant but without a degree knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Gabriela has enrolled in the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias. Often in Bolivia, there are fees for earning your title in public accounting and finance before graduating. She plans on graduating in January 2014, but without a loan she will not be able to afford the graduation fees and thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school.

Gabriela currently works in a shop to help afford her school and living expenses. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Gabriela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. With a career in public accounting, Gabriela expects to earn $15 a day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 38-year-old married man. He has three children, ages ranging from two years to nine years. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are adults. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during rain season, customers are less. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for resale. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all ages. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour, cooking fat, and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat, and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Dildoro

texts.ru: Дилдоро трудолюбивая и заботливая мать 3 детей. Она замужем. Ее муж простой рабочий и имеет маленькую зарплату. Дилдоро уже давно хотела организовать свой бизнес и найти собственного источника дохода, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Дилдоро планирует организовать свой бизнес скотоводством, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошее условие для развития данного бизнеса. Дилдоро участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Дилдоро запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать свой бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dildoro is a hardworking and considerate mother of three. She is married to a simple worker who makes a small income. Dildoro has long wanted to start her own business and find her own source of income. She plans to start a cattle-breeding business since she lives in the country and has good conditions for this type of business.

Dildoro participated in a course called Bring Success, organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and earned a certificate of completion. She is applying for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle for her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Al Anthony

texts.en:
Al Anthony is 21 years old and first of four children in the family. 

He is enrolling in a vocational training in a Call Center course.

He is borrowing 16,000 PHP to fully pay the tuition fees for the skills training.

When he graduates, Al Anthony plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees for the skills training.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 34 years old. She sells food and has been in this business for the past six years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more potatoes and cassava for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Mengel

texts.en:
Mengel is a businesswoman from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and has six school-aged children. She supports her family with her sari-sari (general) store business. 

She joined PMPC in 2004 and has taken previous loans which she has repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she has reached out to PMPC for other funding needs. She applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. She deeply wishes to live a comfortable life in the future with all her children able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Faith Group in Chwele District. She was selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right side with her hand raised. Betty is pictured in a seven-person group of One Acre Fund group leaders. The group leaders represent a total of seventy-six individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured. The field officer is also pictured and is standing on the left side of the photo.

Betty and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
													
Betty is a reliable member of the community. She is married and has four children. Betty is thirty years old and has been working as a farmer for the last twelve years to support her family. In addition to farming, Betty is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group. She described her harvest last year as good. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoy the success she is having with One Acre Fund farm packages. She volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers. 
							
Betty first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to be exposed to new farming methods, as well as acquire fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Betty plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has been beneficial for the farmers. Betty’s own life was improved because she has received farm training, which has enable her to save money and feed her family.  							

Betty and the Faith Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, esta casado, su esposa es costurera, tienen 1 hijo quien estudia el noveno grado. 

Él tiene 25 años de ser comerciante, ya que desde que dejo la escuela, acompañaba a su padre, a comercializar granos básicos, y así fu como aprendió el oficio de comerciante. Ahora  trabaja en  venta de ropa y viaja en bus todos los días, a las ciudades mas cercanas de donde vive. Su día empieza a las 5.30 am y termina a las 4.30 pm.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para invertirlo en la compra de mas mercadería, así se estará contribuyendo, para tenga seguro su trabajo y por ende los ingresos para mantener a su familia.


A José,  le gustaría comprar un vehículo, para ampliar el negocio y trabajar también en las ventas de frutas,verduras y mariscos, también esta dispuesto a ayudarle a su hijo, para que continué estudiando.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, married, and studied through the ninth grade. HIs wife is a seamstress and they have a son who is in the ninth grade.

José has been a merchant for 25 years. From the time he quit school, he worked with his father by selling basic grains. This is how he learned the retail business. José now works by selling clothes. He travels by bus every day to the cities that are closest to where he lives. His day begins at 5:30 A.M. and ends at 4:30 P.M.

His loan will be used for the purchase of more merchandise. This will help to secure his work and eventually lead to income for supporting his family. José would like to buy a vehicle so that he can expand his business. He also wants to sell fruits, vegetables, and seafood. José is willing to help his son so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Jose tiene 73 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con el esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos organicos e inorganicos y fertilizantes . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas en los vende en el miso lugar.

El sueño es tener instalar un sistema de riego ya que existe escases de lluvia . En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 73 years old, married and has a daughter. Jose lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton, in the Los Ríos province of Ecuador.

Jose is a member of the "Anchoveta" communal bank, in the Puerto Pechiche parish of Anchoveta rural settlement. Anchoveta is part of the Pueblo Viejo area and here the people work in agriculture.

Jose makes a living in agriculture - he grows corn, beans and rice. He is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, organic and inorganic manure, and fertilisers. He will be able to buy everything that he needs for his seeds with the help of this loan.

Jose will make his purchases, and later sell his products, in Ventanas.

Jose's dream is to have an irrigation system for the dry season. In his free time, Jose likes to relax and to go out for walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy organic and normal manure, and fertilisers.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Wilma requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, tiene 38 años de edad, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, vive en el municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura, produce cebolla, papa y frejol; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive, a los comerciantes de la población. Es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser tan responsable, desde muy pequeña trabajaba en la agricultura en las tierras de su padre y con mucho sacrificio cubria todos sus gastos, en la anterior campaña y a punto de cosechar la helada quemo su producción. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar semilla de cebolla, abono químico y agroquímicos para tener más producción y de mejor calidad, de esta forma lograra mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Juana is 38 years old and comes from a poor and humble family. Juana lives in the Mizque municipality, in the Cochabamba department. She works in agriculture, growing onions, potatoes and beans, products which she sells to businessmen in the town where she lives.  Juana is well-respected in her community because of her dedication to her work and because she is so responsible. Since a very young age, she has worked in farming her father's land and, with a lot of sacrifice, she has covered all her costs. Last season, just as she was about to harvest her products, the frost damaged her crops. Juana is currently applying for a loan in order to buy onion seeds, chemical manure and agrochemicals in order to have a greater yield, and one of higher quality. With this, Juana will be bale to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, chemical manure and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is at the age of 32 and a responsible mother of four children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has a job in a factory and produces milk part-time. He has some cattle at home and produces milk from cows, which Razia sells in her locality. He has been keeping his herd at home. Through breeding, he has been increasing his cattle for many years.

Razia wants to increase the milk production and buy an additional cow so she can grow the herd. However, due to lack of capital, she is unable to buy the cow. Therefore, Razia requested loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy an additional cow. She hopes that now she can easily carry on her business towards progress. 

She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for milk production.

loans.name: Bold

texts.en: Mr. Bold, 46 years old, still lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. For 18 years he has been rendering taxi service to local people. Using his previous loan, he repaired his garage and built a brick house. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to buy automobile spare parts for car repair. This car is his treasure as well as life blood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора родилась в 1969 году. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Гулнора 5 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она успешно развевает свой бизнес. Гулноре помогает ее сын то введению бизнеса. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Гулнора осознала, что может развевать свой бизнес более успешно и поэтому она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulnora was born in 1969. She is widowed with three children. Five months ago she started a cattle-breeding business. She is successfully developing it; her son is helping her get it going. She is buying cattle, feeding them for a few months and then selling them on the local market. 

Gulnora realized that it's possible to develop the business more successfully and thus wants to increase her working capital.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy cattle, so that she can ultimately increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire a new employee and to purchase furniture and computers for her expanded office space.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar is 21 years old and the first of two children in the family. 

He is borrowing 18,500 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

Joemar is currently in the third year of his three-year Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering course.

When he graduates, Joemar plans to be gainfully employed so that he can help his family to uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Letecia has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Letecia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc..

Letecia has been in this business for one year. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 41 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Joy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Joy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kusumbala

texts.en:
Kusumbala, age 26, is an ambitious woman who lives in a remote region in West Tekatuli  in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and raising her two sons together with her husband.  Her husband Shyamal, 35 years old, runs a cycle shop. Kusumbala attended school up to class VI (Grade 6) and her husband completed his primary education.  Both of their sons are receiving an education and are in secondary school l (Grade 8 and Grade 6, respectively). They live in their own semi-pacca house (brick-built wall and thatch roof).

Kusumbala's husband has a small cycle shop.  He repairs cycles and sells spare parts and in this way, he earns money for his family.  Kusumbala also tries to support her family financially. Yet they are unable to give enough financial sustenance to their family. It is very difficult for them to maintain the educational expenses of their children.

Kusumbala wants to start a new business cultivating tea plants. She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase tea saplings and fertilizers to grow tea leaves. She decided to farm tea plants because the crop is in demand and famous in India. Indian people usually offer tea when anyone visits their place.

She aspires to earn great profits from this business  She aims to escalate her tea cultivation business in the future. She is thankful to the lenders at BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase tea saplings and fertilizers

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a mother of four children. She is a housewife, and her husband owns a small shop where he sells liquid toilet cleaner. He makes the toilet cleaner with phenol and other acids. He is only earning person in the family. 

He fulfills the needs of his family with many hurdles and difficulties. He purchases phenol and other useful acids for making liquid toilet cleaner and then sells it in the main market. By doing this, he generates income to provide food and clothing for his family.

Rizwana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will purchase phenol and acids for making liquid toilet cleaner. This will help him to continue generating income to sustain the life of his family. 

Rizwana hopes that the loan would be a productive one for her husband. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase phenol and acids for making liquid toilet cleaner to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Alicia

texts.es:
Gladys es una joven ecuatoriana nacida en la ciudad de Latacunga tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa propia junto a la de su madre, quien tiene una pequeña discapacidad en su brazo, la casa está ubicada en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia San Juan de Pastocalle en una zona rural de la ciudad, este sector es muy reconocido por la actividad de crianza de animales menores.
Gladys no tiene hijos construyo su casa con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que su madre le heredo un pequeño terreno, ella es un apoyo muy grande para su familia ya que trabaja en una plantación y además tiene sus animales como son cerdos y pollos, su madre es quien le ayuda con el cuidado de los animales, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, se dedica a este trabajo en la mañana y en la tarde, considera que lo más difícil de esto es cuando se queda sin alimento para sus animales, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para salir adelante y ser una persona de éxito.
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que algún momento pueda comprarse un carro ya que esto le serviría de mucho por la distancia,  hoy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más cerdos y alimento, esto ayudará que sus ingresos aumenten y mejoren su vida. Gladys  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Gladys is an Ecuadorian young woman that was born in the city of Latacunga, she is 31 years old, single and lives in a house she owns with her monther, who has a small disability in her arm, her house is located in the city of Latacunga, in the district San Juan de Pastocalle, a rural zone of the city that is known for raising small livestock.
Gladys doesn't have children, she built her house with much effort and sacrifice after her mother inherited a small piece of land, she is a big support to her family because she works at a plantation and also has livestock such as pigs and chickens, her mother helps her taking care of the livestock, she learned the activity from her mother.  She works on this during the morning and afternoon, she thinks the most difficult part is when she rans out of feed for her animals, but this hasn't been an obstacle to keep going and be a person of success.
Her biggest dream in life is to be able to buy herself a car, this would help her a lot to cut distance, today she is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and feed, this will help her increase her income and improve her life.  Gladys is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making her work and personal life better.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed to improve her income.

loans.name: Elba Leticia

texts.es: Elba, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y reside en una aldea de Choloma, Cortes. Doña Elba después de haber trabajado varios años en una maquila, se dedico a la venta de ropa usada, carteras, sandalias, ropa de cama y artículos para el hogar, las ventas las realiza por pedidos y vende en su casa. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo que es por 11,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como cemento para reparar una pared a su casa, con el fin de ir mejorando su condición de vida poco a poco. Su plan es seguir con el negocio para obtener ingresos y poder ampliar mas su casa.
texts.en:
Elba is 48 years old, single, and resides in a neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.  After working several years at a factory, Doña Elba began selling used clothes, purses, sandals, bedding, and household goods.  Her sales are made by accepting orders and offering products from her home.  

The loan she is requesting, which is her second one, is in the amount of 11,000 HNL and will be used to buy materials, such as cement, for repairing a wall in her house.  In the end, this will gradually improve her living conditions.  Her plan is to continue with her business so that she can generate income and be able to expand her house even more.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing a wall in her house.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta viene de una familia que se esfuerza por mejorar, que lucha y que siempre se han destacado por el trabajo.
Ella está estudiando para ser profesora universitaria, ya que quiere poder seguir creciendo, pues sabe que estudiando es la única forma de poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando por cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Marta comes from a family that strives to improve and is always willing to work. She is studying to become a university professor. Marta wants to keep growing and she knows that this is the only way for her to fulfill this goal.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her tuition and degree expenses. This will enable her to continue working toward the accomplishment of her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition and degree expenses.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора 30-летняя швея, проживает в районе Рудаки. Она на протяжении более 4 лет занимается швейным делом. Ситора  замужем, имеет двух детей. Ее муж не найдя хорошо оплачиваемую работу на родине, уехал на заработки в другую страну. Ситора энергичная и умелая женщина. Она успевает и присматривать за детьми и одновременно заниматься собственным делом. Ситора шьет в основном женские национальные платья разных фасонов. Клиентки всегда остаются довольными ее услугами. Сейчас Ситора хочет расширить свое швейное дело и просит кредит для купли новой компьютерной швейной машинки. Благодаря этой машинке она будет шить быстрее и качественнее, а также сможет делать на платьях красивые модные вышивки.
texts.en:
Sitora is a 30-year-old seamstress, living in the Rudaki region. She has working as a seamstress for over four years. Sitora is married and has two children. Her husband, not able to find well-paying work, left to work in another country. 

Sitora is a high-energy and intelligent woman. She looks after her children and at the same time is engaged in her work. She sews mainly women's traditional dresses in various styles. Her customers are always pleased with her work. Now Sitora wants to expand her sewing business and is asking for a loan to buy a new computerized sewing machine. With this machine she will be able to sew faster and better and be able to make dresses with beautiful decorative embroidery.

loans.use: to buy a new computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
The Tegal Sari group receives their new loan. After evaluation by the FO (field officer), they receive the same loan amount. When it was disbursed, one member was unable to attend because she had a religious ceremony in her temple.

Ni Ketut, as the head, personally feels the benefits from the pig breeder program. Running the eight loans, the profit received helped her get income to fullfill her daily needs, school fees, and also savings. Although she still need the loan, she and the members of Tegal Sari group keep their spirits to maintain the businesses. 

She will use this loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed.  As per her plan last period, she will also buy a sow using her own money, with support from her husband. She wants to sell piglets.

The Tegal Sari group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva, lenders and the group will run smoothly and can support them until they have enough savings to use the capital to run the businesses by themselves.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and quality feed

loans.name: Hojaloy

texts.ru: Хочалой родилась в 1967 году. Она жизнерадостная женщина. Хочалой замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж занимается скотоводством. Хочалой начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды 5 месяцев назад. Хочалой научилась у мастера по шитью женской одежды как аккуратно и качественно шить национальные женские платья. Хочалой теперь хочет развевать свой бизнес и привлечь больше клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hojaloy was born in 1967. She is a cheerful woman, married with two children. Her husband raises livestock. Hojaloy started her own business sewing women's clothing five months ago. 

She studied with a professional as an apprentice and learned how to sew traditional women's dresses. Now she wants to develop her own business and attract more customers. Hojaloy is applying for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.name: 15 Corazones Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado 15 corazones, es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, quienes están trabajando y luchando por mejorar, forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar la vida de cada una.
Elizabeth, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre gusta mucho a sus clientes lo que ella prepara. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo y poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Hoy pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, que le permitirá poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called "15 Corazones" (15 Hearts) and is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members are working and striving to improve. They are taking part in the poverty elimination program so that all of them can improve their lives.

Elizabeth, one of the members, sells food that she prepares herself. She says that she has established a very good clientele because they always enjoy what she prepares. Her dream is to continue working and growing so that she can improve her life and that of her family. At the moment she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for her dishes. This will enable her to continue satisfying her customers and improving her earnings.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда замужем и всегда старается воспитать своих детей в духе патриотизма. Мавчуда работает в средней школе своего кишлака уборщицей. Так как у нее маленькая зарплата, она 3 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей орехов. Мавчуда торгует на местном рынке. Она покупает оптом и реализует в розницу. Мавчуде помогает ее муж по введению бизнеса. Мавчуда хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки орехов для пополнения оборотного капитала. С полученного дохода она хочет улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is married and always tries to raise her children in a patriotic spirit. She works as a cleaner in a high school. She has a small salary, so three years ago she started a business buying and selling nuts. Mavjuda trades on the local market, and buys and sells wholesale to retail. Her husband helps her run the business. 

She wants to replenish her working capital and increase her income. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy more nuts. With an increased income, she plans to improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy nuts and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna helps her husband operate their own motor-transportation-based business, the way they make a living, aside from farming. She earns well from their business and she has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC. 

She took a new loan recently to buy new tires to improve the service that they have been providing. She also plans to improve their own farm to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora likes to make snacks and later realized that she can earn income from it. Through snack vending, she is able to support her three school-aged children in school. The business has been doing well for five years now. 

Recently, Flora sought financial support to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She wants to make more snacks so there will be more income, too. Flora hopes that one day, all of her children will finish their studies and have a comfortable life ahead of them.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en: Maria Rita helps her husband work on their own farm to make a living. She has been growing and harvesting assorted kinds of vegetables and selling them in the market, earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used this previous loan to improve her farm. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer and pay land preparation costs. She hopes to have more returns from her investments  in her farm.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay land preparation costs

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja solo atiende el hogar, tiene 3 hijos y 2 están en la escuela, además vive su papá con él.  

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, fue su papá quien le enseñó el trabajo pues siempre le dijo que era bueno estudiar;  pero que era necesario aprender a trabajar, porque sino lograba terminar una carrera tendría como sacar adelante a su familia, además tiene un pick-up con el que hace viajes de donde obtiene otros ingresos, también se dedica a la ganadería, él comienza su día a las 4:30 AM donde primero ordeña sus vacas, luego se toma un café y se va a dejar el ganado, donde algunas veces se queda trabajando en la milpa, luego regresa a las 12:00 MD para tomar su almuerzo y por la tarde le queda espacio para hacer viajes y sus hijos se involucran en el trabajo.    


El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, además una parte será invertido para gastos de educación de su hijo.


Sus sueños es que sus hijos se preparen con una carrera universitaria, ya que él no logró ese objetivo, además sueña con comprar un terreno donde pueda dejarles un espacio a sus hijos para que construyan sus casas.
Con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Miguel has studied through high school and lives with his partner who takes care of their home. He has three children, two of which are in school. His father also lives with him.

Miguel has worked in agriculture since he was ten years old. It was his father who taught him how to work and also always told him it was important to study. But it was necessary to learn how to work because without finishing a university degree he would have to find a way to provide for his family.

He has a pick-up that he uses to do trips to gain extra income. He also raises livestock. He starts his day at 4:30 am where he first milks his cows, then drinks a cup of coffee and leaves the livestock. Sometimes he stays to work in the cornfield. Then at 12:00pm he returns to eat lunch and in the afternoon he leaves time to do trips, which his children help him do.

The loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting of 7,000 square meters of corn. Also, part of the loan will be used to pay for the education costs of his son.

His dream is that his children prepare for a university degree, as he was not able to accomplish this goal. He also dreams of buying a plot of land where he can leave a place for his children to build their own homes. 

With the profits he hopes to pay back the loan and save to accomplish his dreams.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting of 7,000 square meters of corn. Also, part will be used to pay for the education costs of his son.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 32-year-old married woman; she has 2 children, ages 2 and 4. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather which affects sales. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to open a bigger store within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be economically stable. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of clothes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 51-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 5 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will economically and socially sustain her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old married woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add fabric, thread, and other materials for making clothes. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. 

The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 26 years old, is married and has 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. For the past 4 years, Lucy has operated a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are the general public. Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use this KES 10,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. 

Lucy's business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is Lucy's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothing
